title: yuisis_(fire)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Official alternate costume]] of [[Yuisis_(granblue_fantasy)|Yuisis]] from [[Granblue Fantasy]]. 

Released on 2019-12-31 and featured in her character song CD, Saika no Chigiri.

The outfit features a [[black_dress|black]], [[backless_dress|backless]] [[funeral dress]] that shows her [[butt crack]]; [[black gloves]]; a [[black bow]] on her chest; [[black pantyhose]]; and a black [[hair flower]] worn as a [[flower brooch]]. She also has her hair up in a [[high ponytail]].

title: dante_(limbus_company)
body:
The main protagonist and player character of [[Limbus Company]].

Sinner No.10 of [[Limbus Company]] and the executive manager. Based off of the protagonist and author of the 14th century poem "The Divine Comedy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Divine_Comedy written by Italian poet "Dante Alighieri":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dante_Alighieri.

Their [[object head|head]] has been replaced with a red [[clock]] permanently on [[fire]] styled after the [[Doomsday Clock]]. Unlike other sinners, their uniform consists of a unique [[red coat]] and [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]] in addition to the standard [[red necktie]], [[black pants]] but excludes the [[black vest]] and wears an additional pair of [[black gloves]].

If their gender isn't readily apparent within the image, tag them as [[1other]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5028599

title: rim_(kamitsubaki_studio)
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber]] belonging to [[KAMITSUBAKI STUDIO]]. Designed by [[PALOW]].

Voice provider for the [[CeVIO]] voicebank [[RIME (cevio)|]].

RIM has [[medium hair|medium]] [[blue hair]] with [[colored inner hair|inner]] [[red hair|red]], [[multicolored eyes|multicolored]] [[red eyes|red]] and [[blue eyes]] with [[yellow pupils]]. Her hairstyle may change, sometimes being a [[bob cut]] with a [[side braid]] or sometimes a [[wolf cut]], depending on her outfit.

She wears [[diamond earrings]] and a [[hooded jacket]] that resembles her companion, [[Hastur (kamitsubaki studio)|]].

title: kaveh_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable [[List of Genshin Impact Characters|character]] from [[Genshin Impact]]. Voiced by [[Uchida Yuuma]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]]. His outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], [[blue sash]], [[black pants]], hybrid [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]]/[[vambraces]], [[red cape]], [[white shoes]], [[earrings]], and a blue [[feather hair ornament]]. 

The architect behind the Palace of Alcazarzaray, he was a student of the Kshahrewar Darshan of the Sumeru Akademiya and graduated with honors, earning the moniker "Light of Kshahrewar." He often carries an automated [[suitcase]] called [[Mehrak (genshin impact)|]] with him.

title: bismarck_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the German battleship [i]Bismarck[/i]. Character design by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by [[Fukuhara Ayaka]]. 

She is portrayed with [[blue eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]]. Her normal outfit consists of a black [[military uniform]] with [[German flag print|German flag accents]] on her skirt, while her [[peaked cap]] is accented with symbols of the German Empire. She also wears a [[fur_trim|fur-trimmed]] [[cape]] and a pair of [[black boots|black]] [[fur-trimmed boots|fur-trimmed]] [[thigh boots]]. Her [[Bismarck (coat of arms)|coat-of-arms]] is displayed on her left shoulder, and like her sister Tirpitz, she carries a [[flag|pennant]].

She was present in the game since its beginning, serving as the boss for the tutorial. In May 2019, as part of Azur Lane's second anniversary, she was formally introduced as a playable character in the [i]Scherzo of Iron and Blood[/i] event. The announcement of her addition to the game also happened to coincide with the release of the song [i]"Bismarck":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oVWEb-At8yc&vl=en-US][/i] by the Swedish [[power metal]] band, [[sabaton (band)|Sabaton]], leading to Azur Lane's official English twitter account "quoting the opening lyrics to the song":[https://twitter.com/AzurLane_EN/status/1126879577207271424] as a hint to her addition to the game.

title: kirara_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable character from [[Genshin Impact]]. A [[nekomata]] youkai/Gold Level Courier for [[Komaniya Express (genshin impact)|]]; voiced by Julia Gu (EN), [[Suzushiro Sayumi]] (JP), and Sun Yanqi (CN).

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into a [[high ponytail]] with an [[ahoge]], [[hair intakes]], [[sidelocks]], [[double-parted bangs]] hanging [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]] and [[green eyes]]. As a [[nekomata]], she has [[two tails|two]] [[cat tail]]s and [[cat paws]] replacing feet. 

She wears a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]] exposing her [[midriff]], a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[jinbaori]] with an [[egasumi]] pattern, [[blue sleeves|blue]] [[detached sleeves]] overtop [[black bridal gauntlets]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] and [[black leg warmers]]. She has a cat-ear like [[hair ornament]] and multiple [[hairclip]]s in her hair, a [[black choker]], a yellow ornament with [[tassel]]s and a [[neck bell|bell]] and has an [[ema]] with [[jingle bell]]s hanging by her left hip. Her [[vision (genshin impact)|]] is worn in the front on her waist. Kirara's vision element is Dendro and she wields a [[sword]] in battle.


h4. Appearance

* !post #6320575: Default
* !asset #32222093: [[Kirara (cat) (genshin impact)|Cat form]]
* !post #7901236: [[Kirara (Phantom in Boots) (genshin impact)|Phantom in Boots]]
* !asset #32222133: [[Kirara (Post Office) (genshin impact)|Post Office]] 

h6. [[HoYoFair]] costumes

* !asset #32222140: [[Kirara (Teyvat Turboflux) (genshin impact)|Teyvat Turboflux]]

h4. Profile
[expand]

A cheerful girl who enjoys her job at Komaniya Express, Kirara always ensures her customers have a pleasant experience. Her diligence in ensuring her packages always get delivered has increased her and her company's reputation, making her the sole international courier as well. She enjoys these deliveries, as she considers them outings and an opportunity to see different scenery. As a nekomata, she displays several feline tendencies, such as sleeping in [[box]]es and sunbathing on roofs.

Once a small [[kitten]] who wandered the wilds of Inazuma, she had a yearning for human society and after becoming a nekomata, Kirara used her youkai powers to enter [[Inazuma City]] as a human. She eagerly explored every nook and cranny, including the Tenshukaku and was later taught how to be a good youkai by [[Yae Miko]], who also recommended Komaniya Express to her as Kirara particularly enjoyed the streets and [[alley]]s. Upon delivering a package to a long-time customer named [[Chiori (genshin impact)|]], Chiori was immediately displeased with Kirara's appearance and designed the outfit Kirara wears today.

[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]
* [[Pardofelis]] - her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.
* [[Cipher (honkai: star rail)|]] - her [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart.

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Kirara":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Kirara]

She is depicted usually wearing a [[red capelet|red]] [[fur-trimmed capelet|fur-trimmed]] [[hooded capelet]], [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[red dress|red]] & [[white dress]] with a [[black bow|black]] [[dress bow]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[lace-trimmed gloves]], [[arm guards]], a [[black bra]], and [[armored boots]]. Wields a [[battle axe]].

title: shuriken
body:
A shuriken, commonly known as "throwing stars", is a traditional Japanese concealed [[weapon]] that was generally for [[throwing]], and sometimes stabbing or [[slashing]].

They are sharpened hand-held blades made from a variety of everyday items such as needles, nails, and [[knife|knives]], as well as coins, washers, and other flat plates of metal. Though it is commonly depicted in popular culture as a multiple bladed (usually three or four) throwing weapon with a hole in the middle as a holding point.

This weapon is commonly used by [[ninja]]s.

h4. See also

* [[boomerang]]
* [[dart]]
* [[kunai]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shuriken

title: sword
body:
A bladed [[weapon]] designed for cutting or thrusting. They are typically composed of a hilt and a blade with one or two edges that can be straight or curved; most, but not all, swords have a pointed tip. The hilt, in turn, consists of a guard, a grip, and in most designs a pommel. The guard can be a crossguard like in a typical knight's sword, a disc like the [i]tsuba[/i] of a katana, or some more complex design.

It is a weapon strongly associated with elite warriors such as [[knight]]s and [[samurai]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6453581

title: kunai
body:
A [b]kunai[/b], also known as [i]kunai-(shaped)-[[shuriken]][/i] (苦無手裏剣) is a Japanese weapon possibly derived from the masonry trowel. It's a multi-functional weapon that can be used for slashing, stabbing, throwing, and other various uses. It is commonly associated with the [[ninja]]. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Kunai":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunai

title: ninja
body:
A [b]ninja[/b] or [b]shinobi[/b] is a Japanese covert agent/mercenary specialized in underhanded fighting and espionage.

A [b]kunoichi[/b] is a female ninja.

title: azuma_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese large cruiser [i]Azuma[/i], as part of the [[World of Warships]] collaboration. Her censored name is "猉"("Puppy").
Character design by [[Kishiyo]], voiced by [[Yasuno Kiyono]]. 

As a shipgirl, Azuma is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[yellow eyes|golden-colored eyes]], along with [[droopy ears|droopy]] [[dog ears]] similar to [[Takao (azur lane)|]] and [[large breasts|a sizeable bust]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white jacket]] hanging off her shoulders, likely based off Imperial Japanese Navy [[military uniform]]s, a button-up shirt with her [[lace-trimmed bra]] [[see-through clothes|visible past the shirt]], a black [[pleated skirt]], [[black gloves]], and dark-colored [[pantyhose]]. Her personality is similar to [[Atago (azur lane)|]], being very "onee-san" and gently teasing the Commander. 

Her [[rigging]] is themed to act as a chair for her to sit on, with her three 310 mm triple gun mounts to her sides (two on left, one on right) on bow pieces, as well as two 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] to her sides at shoulder level. She also has a reconnaissance seaplane to her lower left, while she uses a [[katana]] as a melee weapon.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3479409: Default
* !post #9513125: [[azuma (career counseling for the groom) (azur lane)|Career Counseling for the Groom]]
* [[Azuma (Soft Voice Of Spring) (Azur Lane)|Soft Voice of Spring]] 
* [[azuma (lily-white longing) (azur lane)|Lily-White Longing]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Design B-65":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Design_B-65_cruiser]

title: gojou_wakana
body:
The male lead of [[Sono Bisque Doll Wa Koi Wo Suru]]. Gojou is a shy student who has a hobby of making traditional Japanese dolls, which another student shamed him for some time ago. After meeting [[Kitagawa Marin]], he starts to come out of his shell after he agrees to assist her in making cosplay outfits.

He has [[very short hair|very short]] [[black hair]] and a [[mole under eye|mole under his right eye]] (e.g. post #5594428). The mole is sometimes [[no mole|missing]] altogether or incorrectly placed under his left eye.

h4. Family

[[Gojou Kaoru]] (grandfather)
[[Gojou Miori]] (elder cousin)
[[Harumi (Sono Bisque Doll Wa Koi Wo Suru)|Harumi]] (aunt)

Voiced by: [[Ishige Shouya]] (JPN), [[Takayanagi Tomoyo]] (JPN, Young), [[Amanda "AmaLee" Lee]] (ENG)

She usually wears [[red scrunchie|red]] [[hair scrunchie]]s, [[crop top]], [[white sleeves|white]] [[puffy detached sleeves]], a [[bracelet]], [[puffy shorts|puffy]] [[white shorts]], and a [[red bandana]] with [[jingle bell]]s.

title: lima_(princess_connect!)
body:
Character from [[Princess Connect!|Princess Connect! Re:Dive]]. She is a member of the guild Elizabeth Park.

She is a [[llama]], but by using a magic apple is able to temporarily take on a human/[[llama girl]] appearance.

In human form, she has [[animal ears|llama ears]], a [[tail]], [[brown eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and an [[ahoge]]. In both human and llama form, she wears a [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]], pink [[bikini armor]], and a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[pink skirt]], and [[pink thighhighs]].

In the real world, she is a sentient llama named [[lima (real) (princess connect!)|Lima]].

She is voiced by [[Tokui Sora]].

h4. Costumes

title: chainsaw_devil
body:
The true form of the Chainsaw Devil from [[Chainsaw Man]], also known as "The Hero of Hell" or "Chainsaw Man". For the same character's dog-like form, see [[Pochita_(chainsaw_man)|]]. For the other character referred to as "Chainsaw Man", see [[Denji_(chainsaw_man)|]].

Do not use this tag for [[Denji_(chainsaw_man)|]] in his Devil form. [[Denji_(chainsaw_man)|]]'s devil form has an orange cover for his [[Chainsaw]] head and two organic arm, while the Chainsaw Devil has a dark grey/black [[Chainsaw]] head and two or four mechanical arms.

title: chainsaw_man
body:
A Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Fujimoto Tatsuki]] that ran in [[Shounen Jump]] from January 2019 to January 2021 and has a sequel that began serialization on July 13, 2022  for Jump+. There is a Fall 2022 anime adaptation by MAPPA.

Set in a world where humans coexists with devils, who are born from humanity's fear. The series focus on [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]], an impoverished man who formed a contract with the devil [[Pochita (Chainsaw Man)|]], transformed him into the [[Chainsaw Devil]] i.e the titular "Chainsaw Man".

h4. Characters

title: nayuta_(chainsaw_man)
body:
A character originally introduced [[Fujimoto Tatsuki]]'s oneshot [i][[Yogen no Nayuta]][/i], she would later be repurposed in [[Chainsaw Man]] as the reincarnation of the Control Devil following [spoiler] [[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s death. [/spoiler]

Nayuta takes the appearance of a young girl with black, shoulder-cut hair and with a single large bang that hangs in front of her face, as well as a mole under her left eye. Her eyes are yellow with multiple red colored rings within them.

h4. Related Characters

* [[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]]
* [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]]
other_names: ナユタ(チェンソーマン)

title: kanzaki_kaori
body:
[[ToAru Majutsu no Index]] character.

An eighteen-year-old Japanese sorceress from Necessarius. Unlike her partner, [[Stiyl Magnus]], she uses magic to magically strengthen her body. Her sorcery name is Salvare000, "The one being saved becomes the hand that saves".

She uses a two-meter-long [[ootachi]] called [[Shichiten Shichitou]] ("Seven Heavens Seven Swords") as her weapon. She has a special attack called Nanasen that uses her sword and thin steel wires.

She used to be a kind woman who treated [[Index (toaru majutsu no index)|]] like a sister, but when Index's memories were deleted by Necessarius, Kaori changed into a cold and silent woman as Index no longer remembered her and consequentially did not trust her. After [[Kamijou Touma]] saves Index's life and her current memories, she decides to let Index stay at Academy City as she feels Touma can protect her.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #28628004
* !post #4657888: [[Fallen angel ero maid costume]]

h4. External links

* "Toaru Majutsu no Index Wiki: Kanzaki Kaori":https://toarumajutsunoindex.fandom.com/wiki/Kanzaki_Kaori

title: hakuhou_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese supercarrier [i]Hakuhou[/i]. Voiced by [[Izawa Shiori]]. 

She is portrayed with [[absurdly long hair|floor-length]] [[white hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of an [[off shoulder]] [[white kimono]], [[black sash|black]] [[obi]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[platform shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces that contain two 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts, complemented by two additional hull pieces containing her [[flight deck]] and [[white wings]]. 

In real life, she was meant as the G-14 Project, an abortive plan by the IJN to succeed the [[Taihou (Azur Lane)|]] and [[Hakuryuu (Azur Lane)|]]/G-15 designs. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #9958708: Default
* !post #9925971: [[Hakuhou (Floral Ninja Roleplay) (azur lane)|Floral Ninja Roleplay]]

title: reze_(chainsaw_man)
body:
Reze, also known as Lady Reze, is a [[Bomb Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]] hybrid from the Soviet Union, who was sent to Japan with the mission of stealing the Chainsaw Man's heart. She is the primary antagonist of the titular Bomb Girl arc.

Also use [[Bomb Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]] when she is in her Devil form.

h4. Related Characters

* [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]]

title: pochita_(chainsaw_man)
body:
A character in [[Chainsaw Man]]. Pochita is the [[Chainsaw Devil]] who embodies the fear of [[chainsaw]]s. He was the original Chainsaw Man (チェンソーマン, Chensō Man) prior to becoming [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s heart and the source of his transformation power.

He is a small, orange dog-like creature depicted in a cartoonish appearance. His distinctive appearance consist of a [[chainsaw]] blade sticking out of his head and a rip cord for a tail.

title: hayakawa_aki
body:
A character in [[Chainsaw Man]], working under [[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s special squad. He had contracts with the Curse Devil and [[Future Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]], and a former contract with the [[Fox Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]].

title: power_(chainsaw_man)
body:
A main character in [[Chainsaw Man]]. She is a [[Blood Devil (Chainsaw Man)|Blood Fiend]] and Public Safety Devil Hunter who is part of [[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s special 4th divison squad. Her abilities include [[hemokinesis|manipulating blood]], which she often uses to form weapons in battle.

She also [[breast padding|pads her chest]], so the chest size she is usually depicted with is a result of padding. This revelation caused [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]] to have an existential crisis.

Voiced by [[Fairouz Ai]].

h4. Related Characters

title: skirt_flip
body:
When a [[skirt]] is flipped inside out unintentionally or by someone playing a [[prank]] on the wearer. When done intentionally, it's a [[skirt lift]] [[lifting own clothes|by the wearer]] or someone nearby holding the skirt.

title: skirt_lift
body:
When a [[skirt]] is lifted up to reveal the crotch. This includes when the skirt is [[lifting own clothes|lifted by the wearer]], [[lifting another's clothes|by another person]], or passively raised up.

See [[skirt hold]] for when the hem of a skirt is held without revealing the crotch. See [[dress lift]] for when a dress is lifted.

h4. Related tags

* [[lifting another's clothes]]
* [[lifting own clothes]]
* [[assisted exposure]]

title: sakurai-san_(mm)
body: Full name: Sakurai Luna (櫻井 月菜/さくらい るな). Prostitute and former classmate of [[Yamada (mm)|Yamada]]. Used to dye her hair blonde in high school but keeps her hair naturally black due to client preferences nowadays.

title: makima_(chainsaw_man)
body:
A main character in [[Chainsaw Man]], she is a Public Safety Devil Hunter and the boss of [[Denji (chainsaw man)|]], [[Power (chainsaw man)|]], and [[Hayakawa Aki|Aki]].

She has light [[red hair]] kept in a [[braid]] and [[yellow eyes]]. Usually depicted as an office lady wearing a long-sleeved tucked in [[collared shirt]] with a [[necktie]]. 

[spoilers]She is actually the Control Devil, one of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse.[/spoilers]

Voiced by [[Kusunoki Tomori]] in Japanese and [[Suzie Yeung]] in English.
other_names: マキマ(チェンソーマン)

title: higashiyama_kobeni
body:
Kobeni Higashiyama is a character from the manga series [[Chainsaw Man]]. She is a Public Safety Devil Hunter who started as a new recruit working under [[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s experimental squad. [spoiler] Kobeni later resigned from Public Safety and quit being a devil hunter after the battle against the [[Darkness Devil|]] in Hell.[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Takahashi Karin]].

h4. Related Characters

* [[Hirokazu Arai (Chainsaw Man)|]]
* [[Himeno (Chainsaw Man)|]]
* [[Violence Fiend (chainsaw Man)|]]
* [[Higashiyama Nobana]]

h4. See also

* [[Kobeni's Car (Chainsaw Man)|]]
* [[Sad Cat Dance (Meme)|]]
* [[Sloppy Blowjob Devil (meme)|]]
* [[Power Crashes Kobeni's Car (meme)|]]

title: para_(vtuber)_(bug)
body:
Debuted as part of [[Para (vtuber)|]]'s updated model reveal on February 8, 2025.
In this form Para is stripped of her rabbit like features and instead now sprouts a pair of [[mandibles]] from her jaw, a large [[abdomen_tail|maggot like tail]] from her back, and [[black sclera|]]

title: hollow_eyes
body:
Eyes that appear to be or are dark empty voids.

h4. Related tags
* [[Empty eyes]] – pupil, iris, and sclera all present; flat iris color and no highlights.
* [[No pupils]] – pupil missing; iris and sclera present.
* [[Blank eyes]] – pupil and iris missing; sclera clearly present.
* [[Solid eyes]] - pupil and iris missing; sclera is color other than white.
* [[Dilated pupils]] – large pupil; iris and sclera present.
* [[Missing eye]] - the entire eyeball is removed, leaving an empty eye socket.

title: jack_torrance
body:
One of the main characters of [[The Shining]], an aspiring writer whose career has stalled because of his anger issues and his alcoholism. Jack Torrance is torn between the love of his family and the resentment he feels against them, which he's been trying to bury rather than deal with. One autumn, he accepts a job as caretaker at the legendary Overlook Hotel in Colorado, hoping to use the winter isolation to focus on his writing...

Source: TV Tropes (spell-checked here)

title: blindfold
body:
A blindfold is a garment worn over the eyes to disable the wearer's sight.

For the blindfold for sleeping, use [[sleep mask]] instead. For masks that cover the eyes, use [[blindfold mask]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[eyepatch]]
* [[bandage over one eye]]
* [[bandages over eyes]]
* [[covered eyes]]

body:

title: blindfold_mask
body:
A [[mask]] that only goes over the eyes, and covers them like a [[blindfold]].

h4. See also

* [[half blindfold mask]]
* [[eye mask]]

title: half_mask
body:
A [[mask]] that only covers half of the face. If this is because the mask is broken, also use [[broken mask]].

For half masks that only cover the mouth and jaw, use [[mouth mask]] instead. For half masks that only go over one eye, use [[half eye mask]] instead. For half masks that only cover one eye, use [[half blindfold mask]] instead. 

h4. Examples

* !post #6772851

title: eye_mask
body:
A [[mask]] that only goes over the eyes, and leaves them exposed.

For masks that cover the eyes, use [[blindfold mask]] instead. For cloth that covers the eyes, use [[blindfold]] or [[sleep mask]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[half eye mask]]
* [[domino Mask]]

title: sovetskaya_belorussiya_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [i]Sovetsky Soyuz[/i]-class battleship [i]Sovetskaya Belorussiya[/i] (Советская Белоруссия) in Azur Lane.

First introduced in the [i]Khorovod of Dawn's Rime[/i] event. Her voice actor is [[Seto Asami]], a role that she shares with another Soviet battleship in Kancolle, [[Gangut (Kancolle)|]].

Historically went unfinished and ultimately cancelled on 19 October 1940 due to serious construction flaws.

title: gem_(steven_universe)
body:
Gems are the fictional alien species that make up a large part of the [[Steven Universe]] cast. All Gems have a gemstone embedded somewhere on them, which is the only true part of their body and acts as a brain. The rest of their body is made of magic light that acts "like a hologram, but with mass" and can be altered in nearly all ways other than color. Their forms can be temporarily altered through shapeshifting or permanently altered through "poofing", the process in which a Gem's form is harmed so badly that it disappears and leaves only the gemstone behind. While poofed, a Gem can take time to choose what they will look like when they reform, and whatever they choose will be their default appearance until they are poofed again.

title: phantom_(arknights)
body:
[i]Phantom, Rhodes Island Operator, melts into the night like a shadow.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lucian

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 19[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]185 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]9 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A lone Victorian assassin with a terrifying voice-based Originium Arts, formerly a member of a destroyed theater troupe. He has now joined Rhodes Island as a Specialist Operator.

He is accompanied by a mysterious [[black cat|black]] [[two tails|two]][[nekomata|-tailed]] [[cat]], [[Miss Christine (arknights)|]].

He was debuted in [i]Illusions of the Past[/i] banner in the side story event [i]Darknights' Memoir[/i], although he makes no story appearance in said event. He later received a major role in the Integrated Strategies event [i]Phantom and Crimson Solitaire.[/i]

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Ishida Akira (voice Actor)|]] (JP), Zhaokun Liu (CN), Ben Cura (EN), Pyo Young-jae (KR), and Vincent Bonnasseau (FR). His illustrator is [[Skade]].

title: hugging_own_legs
body:
Wrapping one's arms around one's own legs, usually in a [[sitting]] position. Sometimes used to express melancholy or contemplation.

This tag also includes [i]taiikuzuwari[/i] ("sports sitting"), a manner of [[sitting]] practiced by Japanese students in gym classes, where they sit hugging the knees.

See [[leg lock]] for wrapping one's legs around another person's body. See [[hugging another's leg]] for hugging another person's leg. See [[knees to chest]] or [[fetal position]] if the person is lying on their back or side.

h4. Example
* !post #7152632
* !post #8889231

h4. See also

* [[Hugging own leg]]
* [[Hugging another's leg]]
* [[Leg lock]]
* [[Legs folded]]
* [[Knee boobs]]
* [[Tag group:Posture]]

title: balancing_rock
body: A [b]balancing rock[/b], also called a [b]balanced rock[/b], [b]precariously balanced rock[/b] ([b]PBR[/b]), or [b]precarious boulder[/b], is a naturally occurring geological formation featuring a large [[rock]] or [[boulder]], sometimes of substantial size, resting on other rocks, [[bedrock]], or on [[glacial till]]. Some formations known by this name only appear to be balancing, but are in fact firmly connected to a base rock by a pedestal or stem.
other_names: バランシング・ロックス

title: balancing_rocks_of_zimbabwe
body: [[Balancing rock]]s are found in many parts of [[Zimbabwe]]. The Domboremari, also known as the Money Rock, is a formation of three boulders that form part of the Chiremba Balancing Rocks on the northwestern outskirts of Epworth. This rock formation is notable because it appears in all [[zimbabwean dollar|Zimbabwean banknotes]] issued since 1981.

title: zimbabwean_dollar
body: The [former] official money of [[Zimbabwe]], suffered from massive inflation during the latter half of the 2000s which led to its abandonment by the Zimbabwean government. Butt of many monetary related jokes due to said inflation.

title: robert_gabriel_mugabe
body: [b]Robert Gabriel Mugabe[/b] (21 February 1924 – 6 September 2019) was a Zimbabwean revolutionary and politician who served as the second president of [[Zimbabwe]] from 1987 until he was deposed in a coup in 2017.
other_names: ロバート・ガブリエル・ムガベ

title: kirisu_mafuyu
body:
Character in [[Bokutachi wa Benkyou ga Dekinai]]. 

She has [[blue eyes]], [[medium breasts]], [[ass|notable ass]], and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[bangs]] and a [[side braids]]. She wears a [[necklace]], [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[pink skirt|pink]] [[pencil skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]].

Voiced by [[Lynn (Voice Actor)|]]. 

h4. See Also

* "BokuBen Wiki: Mafuyu Kirisu":https://weneverlearn.fandom.com/wiki/Mafuyu_Kirisu

title: the_rhodes_colossus
body: [b]The Rhodes Colossus[/b] is an editorial cartoon illustrated by English cartoonist [[Edward Linley Sambourne]] and published by [[Punch (magazine)|]] magazine in 1892. The cartoon depicts British business magnate [[Cecil Rhodes]] as a [[giant]] straddling over [[Africa]] holding a [[telegraph lines|telegraph line]] grounded at the northern and southern ends of the continent, a reference to his desire to build a "Cape to [[Cairo]]" [[railroad tracks|rail]] and telegraph line connecting most of the British colonies in Africa. It is a visual pun of the [[Colossus of Rhodes]], one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

title: cecil_rhodes
body: Cecil John Rhodes (1853-1902) was a British businessman and politician active in the south of [[Africa]] in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, serving as Prime Minister of the Cape Colony between 1890 and 1896. [[Rhodesia]] (comprising modern [[Zimbabwe]] and [[Zambia]]) was founded by and named for him.
other_names: セシル・ジョン・ローズ

title: chrono_trigger
body:

title: edward_kaspbrak
other_names: エディ・カスプブラク

title: beverly_marsh
body: Beverly "Bev" Marsh is a fictional character created by Stephen King and one of the main characters of his 1986 horror novel [[It (Stephen King)|]]. The character is seen as a member of "The Losers Club" and a romantic interest of fellow members [[Bill Denbrough]] and [[Ben Hanscom]].

title: ben_hanscom
body:
Benjamin "Ben" Hanscom is a major protagonist of the Stephen King universe.

Serving the as one of the main protagonists of the novel IT, its miniseries adaptation and its two film adaptations, IT and IT: Chapter Two. He is also a mentioned character in Insomnia, and 11/22/63 (novel).

He is the smartest member of The Losers' Club. He is also friends with [[Bill Denbrough]], [[Richie Tozier]], [[Stanley Uris]], [[Eddie Kaspbrak]], [[Mike Hanlon]] and [[Beverly Marsh]].

title: richie_tozier
body:
Richard "Richie" "Trashmouth" Tozier is a major protagonist of the [[Stephen King]] multiverse.

Serving as a main protagonist of the novel [[It (Stephen King)|]], its miniseries adaptation, and its two film adaptations, IT and IT: Chapter Two. He also appears in [[11/22/63 (novel)|]] as a minor character (alongside [[Beverly Marsh]]).

title: ragnell
body:
A legendary two-handed sword from [[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]] and [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn|Radiant Dawn]]. A blade said to be powered by a goddess and once wielded by [[Altina (fire emblem)|]], it is famously used by [[ike (fire emblem)|Ike]] throughout his multiple appearances.

It has a sister blade known as [[Alondite]].

title: alondite
body:
A legendary two-handed sword from [[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]] and [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn|Radiant Dawn]]. A blade said to be powered by a goddess and once wielded by a [[altina (fire emblem)|heroine of legend ]], its most known user is the [[black_knight_(fire_emblem)|Mysterious Black Knight]]

It has a sister blade known as [[Ragnell]]

Also known as "Ettard"

title: list_of_weapons_in_fire_emblem

title: amy_(another_eden)
body:
[B]Amy[/B] is a main character in [[Another Eden]]. She is a human from the future who fights Synths. 

Amy has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], a [[side ponytail]] tied with a [[green_ribbon|green]] [[hair ribbon]], and [[orange eyes]]. She wears a [[red_coat|red]] [[long coat]], a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white tube top]], [[dog tags]] on a [[necklace]], a [[red belt]] with [[buckle]], [[black shorts]], a [[bandaged leg]], [[knee pads]], and [[black_footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots]]. She is often drawn with an [[open coat]] showing [[midriff]]. 

As a fist-fighter Amy uses gloves, usually [[fingerless_gloves|fingerless]] [[gauntlets]]. 

h4. See also

* Amy - Another Eden Wiki: https://anothereden.miraheze.org/wiki/Amy
other_names: エイミ(アナザーエデン)

title: eats_a_lemon_and_dies_(meme)
body:
A meme in which a character eats a [[lemon]], audibly munches it for a few seconds, and finally "dies" with a distorted scream and appearance.

The meme originated from a video titled "sonic eats a lemon and dies":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XgNI_haDmAA] made using [[Discord]] emojis. This version simply had [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] grunt at the end. A later parody with [[Hatsune Miku]] titled "miku eats a lemon and dies":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pd6dCUiqo2w] added a longer and more audible munching as well as the distorted scream at the end. This version became the more well known version of the meme.

h4. See also
* [[Thour (meme)]]

h4. External links

* "YouTube: sonic eats a lemon and dies":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XgNI_haDmAA]
* "YouTube: miku eats a lemon and dies":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pd6dCUiqo2w]
* "KnowYourMeme article: Eats a Lemon and Dies":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/eats-a-lemon-and-dies]

title: blake_belladonna
body:
Blake Belladonna is one of the main characters of [[RWBY]], a 3DCG series produced by Rooster Teeth. 

Blake is the "B" in RWBY, and is associated with the color black. Her character design is inspired by both of the eponymous characters in the fairy tale [[Beauty and the Beast (fairy tale)|]].
Blake is somewhat aloof, enjoys reading, and seems to have a checkered past. 

h4. Abilities 
She wields a [[katana]]/[[cleaver]]/[[handgun]]/[[kama_(weapon)|kama]] hybrid weapon named [[Gambol Shroud]] (officially classified as a "Variant Ballistic Chain Scythe"). Using the [[ribbon]] around her arm as a chain, it resembles a [[kusarigama]]. Her symbol is a belladonna (aka deadly nightshade) [[flower]]. Her semblance (special ability) produces shadow clones. 

h4. Physical characteristics 
Blake has [[yellow eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]]. 

[spoiler]Her bow hides a pair of [[cat ears]].[/spoiler]

She stands 5' 6" tall (including high heels).

h4. Attire 
Blake tends to wear black and white clothing. She usually has a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]] on top of her head. Her default outfit includes a small [[black scarf]] around her neck, a black [[vest]] with long [[coattails]] on top of a white [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[crop top]] that leaves her [[bare shoulders|shoulders]] and [[midriff]] bare, a black [[single_detached_sleeve|detached sleeve]] on her left arm, black [[arm ribbon]]s wrapped around both forearms, [[white_shorts|white]] [[shorts]] (sometimes depicted with [[garter straps]]) [[pantyhose under shorts|over]] [[black pantyhose]] (with her belladonna symbol printed on), and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. 

Her Beacon [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] with [[neck ribbon]], brown [[blazer]], and [[plaid skirt]]. She retains her black hair bow. 

h4. External links

* "RWBY Wikia: Blake Belladonna":https://rwby.wikia.com/wiki/Blake_Belladonna

She has a [[braid]] on her left side, a [[white hat|white]] [[baseball cap]] and [[multiple earrings]]. Her main outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[lace-trimmed shirt|lace-trimmed]] [[crop top]] with a [[turtleneck shirt|turtleneck]] and a [[necklace]] showing her [[midriff]] and [[navel]], with another [[grey shirt|grey]] [[buttons|button-up]] [[shirt partially removed|partially removed]]. She also wears [[grey pants]] with an [[open fly]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]].

title: the_legend_of_zelda:_echoes_of_wisdom
body:
The twenty-first installment in the [[The Legend of Zelda|Legend of Zelda]] series, released on September 26, 2024.

Announced in the "June 18, 2024 Nintendo Direct (26:16 mark)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kX3BkD5PVUM&t=1576s], it is the first mainline [i]Zelda[/i] title to feature [[Princess Zelda]] herself and not [[Link]] as the main character. She previously was the protagonist in the Philips CD-i spin-offs [[Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon]] and [i]Zelda's Adventure[/i].

Her gameplay differs from that of Link's, per her association with the Triforce of Wisdom. The trailer shows her wielding a new staff, the [[Tri Rod]], and making use of its powers, including making copies (Echoes) of objects and even enemies. She is accompanied on her journey by [[Tri (Zelda)|]].

title: jerry_(tom_and_jerry)
body:
One of the two titular characters from the [[Tom and Jerry]] cartoon series. Jerry is an anthromorphic orange [[mouse (animal)|]] and a "frenemy" of [[Tom (tom and jerry)|]]. He is often involved into a chase with Tom due to his habit of snacking on Tom's owner's food, particularly [[swiss cheese]].

title: saber_(fate)
body:
A character from [[Fate/stay night]], [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], [[Fate/Zero]], and [[Fate/Extella]]. Saber is the female lead character of [[Fate/stay night]].

A young girl with [[blonde hair]] tied up in a [[single hair bun]] with a [[bun with braided base|braid]], [[green eyes]] and a distinctive [[ahoge]]. Often seen wielding a [[sword]] and wearing [[armored dress]], or a white [[blouse]] and a blue [[skirt]]. The Fate/Zero version is often drawn wearing a black [[business suit]] and hair tied in a [[ponytail]]. In [[Fate/stay night]], her chronological age is approximately in the late twenties, but she appears to be around fifteen, as her physical aging was stopped by magic in the "Sword in the Stone" event until her death in her original timeline.

True Name: [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]], a [[genderswap]]ped version of [[King Arthur (mythology)|King Arthur]].

title: sukumizu_pettan
body: A small, limited‑run figure/garage‑kit series from the mid‑2000s built around original, school‑swimsuit‑themed character designs. It was a collaboration between character designer [[Watanabe Akio]] and sculptor [[Miyagawa Takeshi]] (T’s System), released under the fan circle “Pokopii & T’s” and manufactured/distributed by Clayz. Several releases were sold at events (e.g., Comic Castle 2005; later Wonder Festival/Comiket) and some kits came bundled with a short doujin booklet.

title: neue_ziel
body:
[b]AMX-002 (AMA-X2) Neue Ziel[/b]

A monstrous [[mobile armor]] created in secret by [[Zeon]] remnants, with possible help from [[Haman Karn]] and Axis.

 Guarded by a tough I-Field, loaded with mega particle cannons pointing everywhere and capable of performing all-range attacks with its wired claw arms similarly to the [[Zeong]] by using a quasi-psycommu system, it was a ferocious beast in combat - and to top it off, it had the best Zeon had as its pilot - the Nightmare of Solomon, [[Anavel Gato]].

title: porkpie_hat
body:
A [[hat]] with a flat top and a slightly curved brim going all the way around the crown. It is similar to a [[fedora]] and [[trilby]], but it is shorter with no pinched front. Pork pie hats are often associated with jazz, blues and ska musicians and fans.

Do not confuse with [[boater hat]], boater hats have stiff brims and are often made of straw.

* !post #8999535: [[Boater hat]]. Has flat brims, often made of straw

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: chase_chase_jokers
body:
A competitive multiplayer arcade game developed and published by [[Konami]], released in Japan on December 21, 2022.

It's a 3v3 action game set in a maze-like arena, where two teams—one of "humans" (cute anime-style girls) and one of "Oni" (demon versions of those girls)—compete to collect keys, drop them off at zones to fill an energy meter to 100%, and tag opponents to disrupt them. The gameplay emphasizes teamwork, evasion, and fast-paced chases, with modes for single-player (using tokens) or full multiplayer.

It's been praised for its addictive, unique mechanics as a break from typical arcade shooters or fighters, though it's currently arcade-only in Japan with no Western release announced.

title: sports_utility_vehicle
body:
A [b]sport utility vehicle[/b] (SUV) is a [[car]] classification that has off-road features, such as four-wheel drive and higher ground clearance. SUVs are generally built on light truck chassis and have bulkier dimensions compared to regular cars.

As consumer tastes have evolved to prefer SUVs to standard cars, less rugged takes on the platform have emerged, including SUV-like vehicles based on car chassis, known as [b]CUV[/b]s or "Crossovers." For Danbooru purposes, these types of vehicles are included under this tag.

h4. Examples

title: hanbok
body:
Traditional [[Korean clothes|Korean clothing]]. It is often characterized by vibrant colors and simple lines without pockets. It consists of a bolero-like jacket called a [[jeogori (clothes)|]] and either roomy [[pants]] bound at the ankles ([[baji]]) for men, or a [[long skirt]] ([[chima_(clothes)|]]) for women. A hat called a [[gat (hat)|gat]] is also common.

Hanbok has a long history dating back to the Three Kingdoms period (c. 1st century BCE – 7th century CE) and has independently evolved over centuries.

title: himmel_(sousou_no_frieren)
body:
Himmel is the Hero of the Hero Party in [[Sousou no Frieren]], which consisted of Priest [[Heiter]], Mage [[Frieren]], and Warrior [[Eisen (sousou no frieren)|]].

He is a male human with [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]], with a [[mole under eye|mole near his left eye]]. He wears a [[white cloak|white]] [[hooded cloak]] over his [[blue shirt]]. He wears a [[white belt]] over his [[white pants]] and wears [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. He uses a [[sword]] as a weapon.

Fifty years later, as an [[old man]], Himmel has gone [[bald]], but has a well groomed [[white hair|white]] [[beard]] and [[mustache]]. He wears a [[blue coat|blue]] [[hooded coat|hooded]] [[overcoat]] over over a [[white robe]], with a [[yellow sash]] around his waist. He carries a [[cane]] to help him walk.

title: gyaru
body:
Japanese [[fashion]] style that peaked in the 2000s. Although it has generally declined in real life, it remains popular in anime and fanart.

It has many diverse substyles, but typically involves [[tan]]ned skin, styled and colored hair (sometimes bleached blonde), trendy and often sexy clothing (especially from the shops in the mall Shibuya 109), and heavy [[gyaru makeup]], with a focus on false [[eyelashes]], enlarging the eyes, contouring, and circle lenses. Additionally, many gyaru use the "gyaru-moji" (ギャル文字) style of typing and certain specialized slang (ギャル語). There are also certain common hobbies among gyaru: dancing [[Para Para]] was at one time a very popular activity in gyaru circles.

Two common elements of gyaru looks, especially in anime and manga representations, are tanned skin ([[ganguro]] - especially for older or throwback styles) and bleached hair. However, not every gyaru has tanned skin or bleached hair, and not every character with tanned skin and bleached hair is a gyaru.

Gyaru are usually depicted as energetic or extroverted. In adult media they may be depicted either as a high-school student [[prostitution|prostitute]] or as having an unusually high sex drive.

Male [[gyaru]]s are known as [[gyaruo]]. Do not add the gyaruo tag to a [[trap]] who dresses up as a gyaru.

title: usami_renko
body:
A [[Touhou]] character.

One of the main protagonists in the attached stories of ZUN's Music Collection. She is a physics major from [[Kyoto]] in the near future, and together with her close friend [[Maribel Hearn]] forms the Hifuu Club in search of the occult. She has no relation to [[Gensokyo]], but is aware of it.

She is generally portrayed as an adventurous and daring person in contrast to her more laid-back friend. She also tends to view things from a more objective point.

She can tell time by the stars and determine location by the Moon.

She is mostly depicted with [[brown hair]]. Her signature accessories include a [[fedora|black hat]] with a [[hat bow|white bow]], and later, a [[capelet|black shawl]]. She mainly wears a [[white shirt|white blouse]] and a [[black skirt]]. She is also often seen carrying a book.

Her connections to [[Usami Sumireko]] are currently unknown, but their identical surnames and both having hailed from the [[tokyo (city)|Kanto region]] indicate a familial tie.

title: kimono
body:
A type of traditional [[japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]], consisting of a long, [[wide sleeves|wide-sleeved]] robe, closed at the front forming a "y" shape. It is held closed with a wide belt-like [[sash]] called an [[obi]]. The sleeves can be tied back with [[tasuki]].

Kimonos are often worn with other traditional accessories, such as [[zouri]] (traditional wooden sandals), [[tabi]] (split-toe socks), and [[kanzashi]] (traditional hair ornaments). A [[kinchaku]] (small cloth drawstring bag) is often carried while wearing a kimono.

Kimonos come in many different styles for different occasions. [[Yukata]] are worn during summer to [[summer festival]]s or to [[onsen]]s. [[Furisode]] are formal kimonos worn by unmarried women. [[Uchikake]] and [[shiromuku]] are worn by [[bride]]s during [[wedding]] ceremonies.

title: trembling
body:

Often depicted in art with short, wavy [[motion lines]] surrounding the outline of the body. Sharper, less subtle lines depict [[twitching]], which is more violent and momentary.

Not to be confused with [[^^^]], which expresses reaction.

title: speed_lines
body:
A type of [[motion lines]] that indicate fast speed. Usually drawn as a large number of lines surrounding the character, or encompassing the entire background.

When used directly on objects, esp. in the foreground, these may be accompanied by [[motion blur]] effects.

Not to be confused with [[emphasis lines]], which do not indicate motion, but rather are used dramatically to draw attention to a specific part of the image.

h4. Examples

* !post #1297891

h4. See also

* [[motion lines]]
* [[attack trail]]

title: emphasis_lines
body:
Lines drawn in a burst pattern, radiating outward from a part of the image to which the artist wants to draw attention. They cause the area surrounded by the lines to stand out more in the viewer's eye.

These are not the same as [[speed lines]] or [[motion lines]], which indicate fast motion; emphasis lines indicate [i]focus[/i], rather than motion.

A similar technique used in filmography is to focus the camera toward a specific part of the shot (sometimes off-center) while allowing other parts of the image to become unfocused, thus drawing extra attention to the focused area.

h4. Examples

* !post #2174421

h4. See also

* [[hatching (texture)]]
* [[notice lines]]
* [[shout lines]]
* [[vignetting]]

title: zanka_nijiku
body:
Zanka Nijiku is a character in the [[Gachiakuta]] series. 

He's a combatant Cleaner, and is praised by Enjin to be the youngest Jinki master in their organization.

title: i_want_to_live_(meme)
body:
[[Parody]] of a scene from the Enies Lobby arc of [[One Piece]], featuring [[Nico Robin]] [[crying|broke down in tears]] after learned that the [[Straw Hat pirates]] has come to rescue her from the [[CP9]], after she handed herself over to protect the group from being targeted by the World Government.

[spoiler]This particular line was said by Robin after [[Monkey D. Luffy]] urged her to say "I want to live!" to confirm that she wanted to stay with the group. Robin, whose entire life was ruined, betrayed, and manipulated by the World Government, felt that the friendship offered by Luffy and the group was genuine, despite that she used to be their enemy and believed that they would abandon her because of this. As such, the original scene was intended to solidify that Robin has finally been "freed" from the hands of the World Government.[/spoiler]

While the original scene was meant to be a heartfelt moment, parodies of this scene instead changed the context into the character in place of Robin begging for their lives as they were facing their doom.

title: comedic_teardrop
body:
A comical depiction of [[crying]] or [[tears]].

A comedic teardrop is used when the tear is drawn on for comedic purposes, rather than to actually represent happiness/sadness/pain/pleasure/etc. They usually have a specific color, rather than being transparent like real tears, and are usually connected directly to the eyes. A teardrop may also accompany [[yawning]].

If the character appears to be actually crying, or the teardrop is transparent, it is usually [i]not[/i] a teardrop. For all other instances of shedding tears that don't properly meet the requirements for teardrop, use [[tears]] instead.

For non-comedic pictures with a single teardrop, use [[single tear]].

h4. Examples

* !post #512078
* !post #514305

h4. See also

* [[Tearing up]]
* [[Tears]]

title: aircraft_carrier
body:
A type of [[warship]] with a flat [[flight deck]] that [[airplane]]s can use as a runway. Essentially serves as a floating, mobile airbase. They superseded [[battleship]] as the main type of capital ship during the end of [[World War II]].

This tag also includes smaller [[helicopter]] carriers that carry helicopters instead of fixed-wing aircraft.

h4. Examples

* !post #5943166: World War II-era aircraft carrier
* !post #8117687: Modern aircraft carrier

h4. See also

* [[Flight deck]]

title: spanking_self
body:
When a character gives themselves a [[spanking]] or is in position to give themselves a [[spanking]].

This is often done for either [[teasing]] or [[masochism]] related reasons.

h4. Examples

* !post #6643111
* !post #7467467
* !post #2401048
* !post #5371262

Eyes tightly [[closed eyes|closed]] in a literal >_< shape. This usually indicates extreme [[happy|happiness]], but it can also be used to indicate pain, [[embarrassed|embarrassment]], or [[sad]]ness.

title: x_x
body:
Both eyes in the shape of a literal X, to show that a character is comically dead, knocked out or just tired.

See [[x-shaped pupils]] for when only the pupils inside the eyes are shaped like X's. This is for when the entire eye is shaped like an X.

h4. Examples

* !post #7489172
* !post #3087779

h4. See also

* [[>_<]]
* [[x-shaped pupils]]

title: taunting
body:
The act of provoking other people into becoming angry or trying to attack the one making a taunt. Typically done by those who were more than capable of dealing with the consequence or is somehow immune to any retaliation. Usually (but not always) incorporating [[insult]]s.

h4. See also

* [[Teasing]]
* [[Come at me Bro]]

* !post #6519037: [[Revolver]] with ridiculous barrel length

title: pom_pom_(clothes)
body:
A small pom pom worn on any piece of clothing, whether it is headwear, body clothing or shoes.

See [[pom pom (cheerleading)]] for the type of pom poms used by [[cheerleader]]s.

h4. Examples

* !post #8623502: [[pom pom earrings]]

title: star-shaped_pupils
body:
When a character's pupils are shaped like a [[star (symbol)|star]]. This tag is only for when the entire pupil is shaped like a star. Use [[star in eye]] for cases where there is a star present inside the eyes. Very often the [[bright_pupils|pupils are bright]].

When indicating eyes lighting up in excitement, use [[+_+]] instead. [[+_+]] is for fleeting excitement, star-shaped pupils are the character's permanent eye shape.

Do not confuse with [[cross-shaped pupils]] or [[diamond-shaped pupils]], which are not star-shaped.

h4. Examples

* !post #9461642: Dark four-pointed

title: color_coordination
body:
Characters or objects matching each other in color, or creating a sense of symmetry.

There must be multiple groups of separate colors to create the sense of "coordination". If there is only a single group with a single color, use [[color connection]] and the corresponding {{*_theme|color theme}} tag instead. For instance, post #4734135 is [[yellow theme]].

If there are multiple color groups but the characters are simply cosplaying and their matching pair isn't present (e.g. post #1490134), use [[color connection]] instead.

This technique is often associated with [[lineup]]s or [[column lineup]]s. When the columns are each completely monochromatically themed on a single color, it becomes [[multiple monochrome]].

If the coordinated colors form a rainbow, it's also [[rainbow order]].

h4. Examples

title: dao_fu
body:
A symbol used as a good-luck charm in Chinese-speaking countries. It consists of the "福" character (the [[good fortune symbol]]) being placed upside down.

Commonly seen on the square-shaped [[Chinese New Year]] decoration, the [[doufang]].

[i]Dao fu[/i] ([i]dao[/i], lit. "upside-down", and [i]fu[/i], "fortune" or "good luck") is a homonym of 到福 ("fortune arrives") in Chinese (and most dialects of Chinese).

title: haki_(one_piece)
body:
[b]Haki[/b] (lit. "ambition, aspiration") is a special technique found in the world of [[One Piece]].

Haki is a type of spiritual energy that allows the user to perform various superhuman feats by harnessing their willpower. As Haki is directly tied to one's psyche, in theory everyone is capable of accessing it. However, unlocking the use of Haki can be prove very difficult for those who are not aware of it.

Typically, Haki can be identified by an [[aura]] of black-and-red [[lightning]] around the user.

h4. Types of Haki

* Observation Haki: Allows the users to read their opponents' movements and detect the presence of others.
* Armament Haki: Grants protection, increased offense and counters certain [[Devil Fruit]] abilities (mostly Logia types). Appears as a black coating on the body and weapons wielded by the user.
* Supreme King Haki: The rarest type of Haki that only few "chosen ones" possesses. Allows the user to enforce their will on weaker opponents, rendering them unconscious. In addition, an experienced user of Supreme King Haki can infuse it into their weapon or attacks, thus significantly increasing their power.

h4. Examples

* !post #8081385: Typical Haki lightning aura
* !post #8438305: Armament Haki-infused punch

title: wolfsbane_(flower)
body:
[i]Aconitum[/i] (also known as aconite or wolfsbane) is a genus of poisonous [[flower]]ing plants in the [i]Ranunculaceae[/i] family. 

The color of the flowers usually varies from blue to purple, some species are yellowish. They consist of five petals that form a characteristic shape resembling a hood or helmet. This shape gave it its common names, such as [i]devil's helmet[/i], [i]helmet flower[/i], [i]monkshood[/i], [i]torikabuto[/i] (鳥兜 lit. "bird's helmet":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鳥兜). The leaves are lobed.

Most Aconitum species are highly poisonous and were historically used to poison the tips of javelins and arrows.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21051832: [i]Aconitum napellus[/i]
* !asset #21051872: [i]Aconitum degenii[/i]

title: wapol
body:
A villainous character from the manga and anime [[One Piece]]. At some time during the backstory of the series, he ate the [i]Munch-Munch Fruit[/i], allowing him to eat anything he wants and to either assimilate it into his body or fuse it with other objects he ate.

He once ruled over the Drum Kingdom as a tyrant, but was deposed by [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] and his [[Straw Hat pirates|crewmates]].

Later, he (accidentally) created a new type of metal alloy using his powers, Wapometal, which made him so obscenely rich, he became the king of a World Government-affiliated kingdom.

He was one of the rulers invited to the Levely, where he unwittingly not only learned of the existence of [spoiler][[Imu (One Piece)|]][/spoiler], he also saw [spoiler]them and the [[Gorosei|Five Elders]][/spoiler] murder [spoiler][[Nefertari Cobra|King Cobra]][/spoiler], which resulted in [spoiler]both him and [[Nefertari Vivi|Vivi]][/spoiler] becoming fugitives from [spoiler]the World Government[/spoiler] for learning about the existence of [spoiler][[Imu (One Piece)|the hidden king of the world]][/spoiler] resp. being the [spoiler]descendant of [[Nefertari D. Lily]] [/spoiler].

title: grape_hyacinth
body:
[i]Muscari[/i], commonly known as grape hyacinth, is a genus of [[flower]]ing bulbous plants in the family [i]Asparagaceae[/i].

Grape hyacinths are conical or urn-shaped flower clusters that resemble a bunch of grapes, hence the name. The flowers are usually light [[blue flower|blue]] to [[purple flower|purple]], although some species are white, pink or yellow.

Note that this flower is not an actual hyacinth, so it should not be tagged as such.

title: adonis_(flower)
body:
A genus of about 20-30 species of [[flower]]ing plants of the crowfoot family, [[ranunculus|Ranunculaceae]], native to Europe and Asia. Their flowers are red, yellow or orange and have 5-30 petals with feathery, finely divided leaves that form a fluffy collar around each individual flower.

Commonly depicted members of the genus are [i]Adonis amurensis[/i], a perennial plant with a double-flowered [[yellow flower]] that has around 20-24 petals each, and [i]Adonis ramosa[/i]. Their Japanese name "Fukujusō" means "fortune-longevity-plant", so they’re also used for planting at [[New Year]]'s parties.

h4. Examples

title: ranunculus
body:
[i]Ranunculus asiaticus[/i], also known as Persian buttercup, is a cultivated ornamental species of the genus [[buttercup (flower)|Ranunculus]] in the family [i]Ranunculaceae[/i]. Common colors include shades of pink, red, orange, yellow, and white.

Visually, the flowers of ranunculus asiaticus are very similar to [[rose]]s and can be difficult to distinguish. They can be identified by their buds, flower shape, and leaves:

* The buds of ranunculus are globular;
* The flowers are densely packed with overlapping petals that, unlike roses, retain a neatly rounded shape with less protruding petals;
* The center of the flowers is very distinctive;
* The flower stems have no thorns;
* The leaves are deeply lobed, resembling many [i]Ranunculaceae[/i] species, making them very different from rose leaves.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21801262: Flower and bud
* !asset #21801263: Opened center of the flower
* !asset #15521010

title: skeleton_flower_(plant)
body:
[i]Diphylleia grayi[/i] (lit. double-leaf of Gray) is a species of [[flower]]ing plant of the genus [i]Diphylleia[/i] in the family [i]Berberidaceae[/i] (barberry family). It is known for its [[white flower]]s that become [[transparent flower|translucent]] in rain or high humidity, earning it the common name [i]skeleton flower[/i].

Diphylleia grayi flowers have six obovate white petals and six yellow stamens surrounding a green pistil in the center. After blooming, the flowers turn into blue to purple berries.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21948304: Before rain
* !asset #21948297: After rain

h4. See also

title: liangbatou
body: Chinese hairstyle/headdress worn traditionally by [[Manchu clothes|Manchurian]] women during a period of the [[Qing dynasty]] - namely, through the 19th century. The hair is wrapped around a long frame known as a bianfang to create a rigid, wingspan-like shape. The hair is then decorated with flowers and hairpins. For the larger, more elaborate version of this headdress that came later in history, see [[dalachi_(headdress)|]]. h4. Examples * !post #7401728 * !post #7691730 h4. See also * [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: tear_troughs
body:
Where the eye socket meets the slope of the nose (the infaorbital area), which sometimes creates a prominent groove on the skin between this area.

Tear troughs may be more or less pronounced due to several factors. This includes body fat, skin density, health, and genetics. Tear troughs are more prominent on average amongst women, Caucasians, older individuals, and those who are [[skinny]] or [[emaciated]].

Some characters have pronounced tear troughs as part of their canon design, such as [[Sakata Kintoki (Fate)|]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Tear troughs are known anatomically as [i]nasojugal[/i] folds, grooves or lines. 

h4. Examples

* !post #7420807
* !post #7025019

title: angel's_trumpet
body:
Angel's trumpet is the name given to three species of [[flower]]s, two of which are poisonous, belonging to the Solanaceae family of flowers (the genus of Brugmansia and Datura), and the other belonging to the Plantaginaceae family of flowers.

They can be identified by their larger, trumpet-like shape, with colors ranging from yellow, white, and purple; each color associated with the aforementioned species, respectively.

Not to be mistaken for some types of [[lily (flower)|]], which can bear a resemblance to angel's trumpet, but are much smaller.

h4. Examples

* !post #6177238
* !post #2252154

title: hyacinth
body:
[i]Hyacinthus[/i], commonly called hyacinth, is a genus of [[flower]]ing bulbous plants in the family [i]Asparagaceae[/i].

Hyacinths have tubular, six-petaled flowers that grow in clusters on a leafless, sturdy stem. Cultivated species, such as [i]Hyacinthus orientalis[/i], often form denser clusters, while wild species may have as few as two or three flowers in an inflorescence. Cultivated hyacinths can be almost any color. The leaves are upright and strap-shaped, emerging from the underground bulb and surrounding the stem. The whole plant usually grows to a height of 15-35 cm (6-13.8 in).

title: persian_speedwell
body:
[i]Veronica persica[/i], commonly called Persian speedwell, is a [[flower]]ing plant in the plantain family ([i]Plantaginaceae[/i]). Other common names are: [b]bird's-eye[/b], [b]birdeye speedwell[/b], [b]common field-speedwell[/b], [b]large field speedwell[/b], and [b]winter speedwell[/b]. Native to Eurasia, it exists invasively in Britain, North America, and parts of East Asia.

Its small flowers feature four short, sky blue or purple petals interspersed with thin dark blue stripes. The petals lighten to white as you get closer to the center of the flower. The flowers have two conspicuously protruding stamens.

Not to be confused with [[Nemophila (flower)|]], which has somewhat similar flowers, but unlike Persian speedwell, Nemophila flowers have five petals and five less conspicuous stamens.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23123699: Flower and its two stamens

title: lae'zel
body:
One of the eight Origin characters in [[Baldur's Gate 3]] who can either be the player character or potential party member.

A female [[gith (d&d)|githyanki]] fighter who is driven by ambition and fanatical loyalty to [[Vlaakith]], the [[lich]] queen of the githyanki race. Like most githyanki, Lae'zel is proud, militaristic, and xenophobic, prioritizing her survival and goals, seeing the party as simply means to her ends, and looking down on concepts of the mortal plane such as empathy and altruism. She nonetheless recognizes and respects her companions capabilities, so long as they don't interfere with her goals.

title: astarion
body:
One of the eight Origin characters in [[Baldur's Gate 3]] who can either be the player character or potential party member.

A male high elf rogue and [[vampire]]. Hidden beneath a veneer of flamboyance and charm, Astarion is the most self-centered and callous of the Origin companions, generally preferring to not waste time on helping any unfortunate souls and even further toying with them just for the fun of it.

title: wyll_(baldur's_gate)
body:
One of the eight Origin characters in [[Baldur's Gate 3]] who can either be the player character or potential party member.

A male human warlock who used to be nobility in Baldur's Gate before being exile due to making a warlock's pact with a devil. However, Wyll made a name for himself across the Sword Coast as the heroic "Blade of Frontiers". Despite the Faustian origin of his strength and power, Wyll is a selfless man who puts the protection and safety of others above himself.

title: baby's-breath
body:
[i]Gypsophila[/i], commonly known as baby's breath, is a genus of [[flower]]s in the [[carnation]] family ([i]Caryophyllaceae[/i]), native to Eurasia, Africa, Australia, and the Pacific Islands. Members of the genus have highly branching plants that bear clusters of small white or pink flowers. Often used as a filler for [[bouquet]]s and decorative floral arrangements.

Also known as "bebe's breath", "maiden's breath" and "gyp" after the genus name.

title: ibuki_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Ibuki[/i], as part of the [[World of Warships]] collaboration. Character design by [[Maya G]], voiced by [[Fukuen Misato]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[horns]], [[heterochromia]] eyes ([[red eyes|red on left]], [[blue eyes|blue on right]]), and [[large breasts]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[sideless outfit|sideless]] [[white dress]], white [[detached sleeves]], black [[thighhighs]], white [[platform footwear]], and a white [[hair ribbon]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate pieces attached to her waist containing her five historical 20.3 cm twin gun mounts, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] concealed on the inner side of the hull rigs, two 10 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] on where her rigs connect to the waist, and a [[katana]] attached to her left.

Historically, [i]Ibuki[/i] and her sister, ultimately unnamed, were supposed to be successors to the [[Mogami_(azur Lane)|]]-class cruisers, with similar armament. However, due to the increasingly dire wartime situation for Japan, [i]Ibuki[/i] was converted into a light aircraft carrier. The war came to an end before she could be completed, however, and she and her sister were scrapped on the slips shortly afterwards.

h4. Appearance

title: panthalassa_(racehorse)
body:
A Japanese thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Lord Kanaloa (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Miss Pemberley (racehorse)|]] (this makes [[Montjeu (racehorse)|]] his damsire), he is famed for his extreme front-runner running style that is reminescent of both [[Twin Turbo (JPN) (racehorse)|Twin Turbo]] and [[Silence Suzuka (racehorse)|]].

He is a bay horse with no markings. He is usually distinguished with his mane tufts and his red and white hood.

Due to his running style and initial limited successes, he was nicknamed the "Twin Turbo of the Reiwa era". But then, starting in late 2021, he started winning bigger and bigger races and was particularly successful overseas, culminating with first G1 win at the 2022 Dubai Turf (albeit, a dead heat, sharing the prize with another horse) and then, despite being more of a turf horse, he won his second G1 win at the 2023 Saudi Cup, which happens to be the race with the largest purse ever held. With this feat, he became the first Japanese horse to have won G1 wins overseas on both turf and dirt as well as instantly catapulting him into second place of Japan's top earning racehorses, having more than doubled his earnings in that one race. Due to his successes overseas, he was rechristened "Panthalassa of the world", a nickname that mirrors his sire's own nickname.

Another race of note for Panthalassa was the 2022 Autumn Tenno-sho. The race saw the front-running horse lead the race by a wide margin, on top of the fact that he ran the race at the same time as Silence Suzuka's ill-fated run of the same race in 1998, even though the race concluded with [[Equinox (racehorse)|]] catching up to Panthalassa and winning the race by a horse length. 

In the context of [[Umamusume]], he is most often referred to in fanart in the context of fellow front-runners [[Twin Turbo (umamusume)|]] and [[Silence Suzuka (umamusume)|]] but also in light of [[Maeda Rena]] proclaiming she is Panthalassa's mother, leading to pictures where [[Grass Wonder (umamusume)|]] is treating a baffled horse girl Panthalassa as if she was her baby. Typically, a horse girl Panthalassa is portrayed with a [[ponytail]] or a hairstyle with multiple ponytails, white and red [[ear covers]], a marine-style costume or something that evokes Pangaea and an accessory on or around her right ear.

h4. See also

* [[Lord Kanaloa (Racehorse)|]] (Sire)
* [[King Kamehameha]] (Grandsire)
* [[Montjeu (Racehorse)|]] (Damsire)
* [[Contrail (racehorse)|]] - Triple Crown winner; contemporary and stablemate to Panthalassa

title: chinese_knot
body:
A decorative [[knot]] made from a single length of cord that is woven into different shapes, with each shape having a symbolic meaning. The knots are usually double-layered and symmetrical.

Chinese knots are commonly red, a color associated with good luck in Chinese culture, although any color can be used.

For a similar knot, but are made up of more rows, see [[panchang knot]].

A type of [[Chinese knot|Chinese]] [[endless knot]], and one of the eight symbols of [[Buddhism]]. A symbol of good luck. It can have a varying amount of rows, but it always forms a tightly bound square.

title: fujimaru_ritsuka_(female)
body:
The protagonist of [[Fate/Grand Order]] if selected as female.

She has [[orange hair]], [[orange eyes]] and an [[ahoge]]. In her default attire which is [[Chaldea uniform]], she has a [[side ponytail]]/[[one side up]] tied by a yellow [[hair scrunchie]], and wears a [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]] and a pair of [[white boots]].

She has roughly the same characterization as the [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (Male)|male version]]. She does, however, have an alternate characterization from the "Learn with Manga!" (pool #10385) comics, where she is more depraved and quick to [[female pervert|perv]] on other female Servants, particularly [[Mash Kyrielight]].

The [[fujimaru ritsuka (male)|male protagonist]] is colloquially called Gudao. The name Gudako could come from an abbreviation of [b]Gu[/b]rando Oo[b]da[/b]a, or from "Gudaguda Order" (ぐだぐだオーダー), an official series of Grand Order comics ("English":[http://fate-go.us/gudao/], "Japanese":[https://www.fate-go.jp/gudao/]). Ko is a common ending for female names and can also mean girl.

Her appearance is based on [[Emiya Shirou]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sekine Akira]]

title: two-legged_horse_(kanji)
body:
The kanji for "horse" written with two strokes instead of four.

The kanji for "horse" is normally written as 馬, with four strokes at the bottom representing a horse's four legs. As quadrupedal horses do not exist in the [[Umamusume]] universe, instead being replaced with bipedal [[horse girl]]s, the kanji for "horse" in this setting is written with two strokes at the bottom instead of the usual four.

Use this tag for posts containing examples of this unusual variant kanji.

h4. Examples

* !post #4432118: Second panel from the top
* !post #6636313: First panel from the top

h4. See also

* [[Umamusume]]

title: cornelius_(odin_sphere)
body:
An [[Odin Sphere]] character. He's the prince of the kingdom of Titania. He's in love with [[Velvet (odin sphere)|]] and both are often seen together in art.

Due to a curse, he's transformed into a [[Pooka (odin sphere)|]] and loses much of his identity. Wields a [[psypher (odin sphere)|]] sword in which the crystal itself is the entire blade.

title: in-universe_location
body:
A recognizable location in a game, anime, or other fictional universe. 

It should be recognizable either through landmarks, architecture, terrain, and if it's the [[indoors|interior]] of a house or other structure, through floor, walls, furniture, or some other notable characteristic.

Examples include towns, levels, stages, dungeons, outdoor locations or hub areas in video games; the school, or the student council room in a slice-of-life anime; the tournament arena in an action manga; etc.

h4. Examples

body:
A vast array of traditional Japanese hairstyles ([[nihongami]]) worn by unmarried women; all of which share the trait of vertically-tied [[bow-shaped hair]] fastened against the scalp. 

Sometimes tied with a [[motoyui]] (a ribbon similar to a [[hair tubes|hair tube]]).

A notable feature of this style was the use of red cloth to tie the hair.

title: ak-74
body:
The [B]AK-74[/B] ([b]А[/b]втомат [b]К[/b]алашникова образца 19[b]74[/b] года 'Kalashnikov assault rifle model 1974') is a 5.45×39mm [[assault rifle]], developed in Izhevsk Mechanical Plant, 1974. It largely replaced the larger-caliber [[AKM]] in [[Soviet]] service, and many of its parts are interchangeable with the earlier [[kalashnikov rifle|AKs]]. First used by the Soviet [[military]] in the [[War in Afghanistan]] from 1979.

Use this tag solely if the [[weapon]] is depicted with full-bodied, fixed stock, and these characteristics:

* Synthetic brown/orange furniture (pistol grip and handguard), as well as the magazines.
* Distinctive, longer, non-canted [[muzzle device]].
* Fixed stock with elongated indentations on both sides.
* Less-curved [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] profile due to smaller [[rifle cartridge|cartridges]].
* Stamped receiver with visible rivets and smaller rectangular indentation on it.

h4. Examples

* !post #5952944

h4. See also

* [[AK-74M]]
* [[AKS-74]]
** [[MPi-AKS-74]] ([[East Germany|East German]] variant)
* [[AKS-74U]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[RPK-74]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: AK-74":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AK-74

title: nemophila_(flower)
body:
[i]Nemophila[/i], commonly called baby blue eyes, is a genus of [[flower]]ing plants in the family [i]Boraginaceae[/i]. Commonly represented by [i]Nemophila menziesii[/i].

Nemophila flowers are bell/cup shaped, with five stamens and five rounded petals, sometimes with notched tips. They usually come in a range of shades from light blue to purple or pink, becoming white near the stamens. Some species are white and occasionally spotted ([i]Nemophila maculata[/i]). The leaves are lobed or toothed.

Not to be confused with [[Persian speedwell]], which has somewhat similar flowers, but unlike Nemophila, Persian speedwell flowers have four petals and two conspicuously protruding stamens.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21842566: [i]Nemophila menziesii[/i]

title: violet_(flower)
body:
One of the several species of the genus [i]Viola[/i] which also includes [[pansy|pansies]].

All [i]Viola[/i] have five petals, and most violets are deep purple in color, often turning to white and/or yellow at the center.  Some varieties just have white or yellow petals or petals of each color.

African violets (genus [i]Saintpaulia[/i]) and dogtooth violets ([i]Erythronium dens-canis[/i]) are not true violets but may be tagged here as well.

See [[pansy]] for how to distinguish that flower from violets.

h4. Examples

* [[Pansy]]
* [[Tag group:Flowers]]

title: endless_knot
body:
Several [[knot]]s tied together in an intricate pattern; the complexity of the knot can vary, and it has a multitude of meanings in different cultures.

Also known as the [i]infinity knot[/i]. In [[Hinduism]], it's called the [i]Shrivatsa[/i].

It is an important symbol in [[Hinduism]], Jainism and [[Buddhism]]. It's also an important cultural marker in places influenced by Tibetan Buddhism, such as Tibet, Mongolia, Tuva, Kalmykia, and Buryatia. It is also found in [[Celtic knot|Celtic]], Kazakh and [[Chinese knot|Chinese]] symbolism.

The Chinese [[panchang knot]] is a type of endless knot. 

h4. Examples

* !asset #22916528: Various types of endless knots

h4. Subtypes

* [[Panchang knot]]

h4. See also

* [[Celtic knot]]
* [[Chinese knot]]
* [[Lattice]]

title: necrass_(arknights)
body:
[i]Necrass, former leader of Dublinn, visiting Rhodes Island now that all of Dublinn is dead.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real name: Eblana Dublinn

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria (Tara)[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 16th[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Draco[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]172 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]Undisclosed[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

[[Reed (arknights)|]]'s elder twin sister, former leader of the now-defunct armed Taran separatist movement "Dublinn", 
now affiliated with Rhodes Island after her goal to secure Tara's independence is achieved.

Like her sister, she possesses the ability to manipulate life, 
but unlike Reed, hers manifests as something akin to [[necromancer|necromancy]].

First appearing as an NPC in [i]Episode 9: Stormwatch[/i] and [i]What the Firelight Casts[/i], 
later become a playable character in [i]When Elegies Are Ashes[/i]. 

Her callsign is a portmanteau of the prefix [i]necro[/i] ("death") and [i]grass[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Noto Mamiko]] (JP), Fumeng Ruowei (CN), Christina Bennington (EN), and Yoo Bora (KR).
Her illustrator is [[starshadowmagician]].

h4. Appearance

title: wearable_sleeping_bag
body:
A type of [[sleeping bag]] that, as the name suggests, can be worn like a clothing item and allows the wearer to walk around due to the leg protrusion.

Originally, it was a [[meme attire]] in the Japanese community due to a magazine ad featuring a man wearing the sleeping bag while walking in a peculiar pose. In later times, however, it is often mistaken as a reference to the [[Crewmate (among us)|]] from [[Among Us]] due to their strikingly similar appearance, especially with the wearer appearing as if they have [[no arms]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #24802457: The original ad
* !post #689772: [[Touhou]]'s [[Houraisan Kaguya]] wearing the sleeping bag. This image and a derivative of it are often associated with the phrase "haters gonna hate".

title: foxglove
body:
[i]Digitalis[/i] (from the Latin [i]digitus[/i], finger), commonly called foxglove, is a genus of [[flower]]ing plants in the family [i]Plantaginaceae[/i]. One of the most commonly depicted species of Digitalis is [i]Digitalis purpurea[/i], the common foxglove.

Foxglove produces a tall spike covered with long, tubular or funnel-shaped flowers. The flowers are usually spotted and can be pink, red, yellow, purple, and white. The leaves are oval and cover the stem below the flowers. Many species of foxglove are highly poisonous.

h4. Examples

title: g-defenser
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime series from 1985.

[b]FXA-05D G-Defenser[/b]

An [[AEUG]] heavy attack [[starfighter]] developed as a support unit for the [[Gundam Mk II]]. It can combine with it, forming the [[Super Gundam]].
