title: atago_(space_atago)_(greyeth)_(azur_lane)
body:
A fan-created costume by "GreyEth":[https://twitter.com/GreyEth] for [[Atago (Azur Lane)|]].

While visually similar to Atago's [[atago (stunning speedster) (azur lane)|Stunning Speedster]] costume, it is differentiated by a [[cropped jacket|cropped sweater]] in place of the cropped suit jacket, the [[japanese flag|Japanese flag]] on the darker shoulder portions of the jacket (along with the name and initial of "A.Tago"), the logos of various space agencies (namely [[JAXA]], though [[NASA]] and [[SpaceX]] also make appearances) on the sweater, as well as various [[remove before flight tag|"Remove Before Flight"]] pull-tabs on both the bikini top and bikini bottom. The design of the bikini is also different: the logos of the space agencies sometimes appears on the bra of the bikini top, and the bikini bottom has been changed into a [[side-tie bikini]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5670932
* !post #4952572

title: akita_neru
body:
Akita Neru is a [[Vocaloid]] Derivative. Her name ([b]亞北ネル[/b] - [i]Akita. Neru[/i]), in phonetic reading, sounds like "I quit. Going to sleep."

She started out as a meme on 2channel, where a troll user started threadcrapping all Vocaloid related threads. Some user commented that he wouldn't get angry only if the troll was a cute girl. Thus Akita Neru, a tsundere non-Vocaloid net-chara was born. Her image color is orange-ish yellow and her character item is a cell phone. Her design was created by [[Smith Hioka]] in 2007. Neru is sometimes written as a Miku wannabe, others as the anti-hero of the Vocaloid personage. She has been officially recognized as a [[Hatsune Miku|Miku]] derivative by Crypton since 2008, and most vocal representations of Neru uses Miku's voicebank, such as those by Ohshio Kuimu (though some producers use Rin's voicebank, ala NanameueP, and some fans use the phone noises from Triple Baka).

In the West, she's largely remembered for her appearance in [[Triple Baka (Vocaloid)|]]. She would once more return to prominence in 2024 as a result of a meme relating to [[Mesmerizer (Vocaloid)|]], due to a reply to a tweet reminiscing about Triple Baka, where Neru was called ""the yellow one that doesn't appear in Mesmerizer":[https://twitter.com/FailedDumbFuck/status/1800938120416010623]". The wave of Neru fanart that followed would culminate in [[SWAGAMICCHI]]'s fan design for what Neru "could've looked like ":[/posts/7736166] in Mesmerizer. She would have her first major song in years in 2025, with [[Zako (Vocaloid)|]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]
* [[Akita Neru (Ethnic)]]: [[Project Diva]] module
* [[Akita Neru (School Club Girl)]]: [[Project Diva]] module
* [[Akine Haru]]: fusion with fellow Miku derivative [[Yowane Haku]]
* [[Akita Nero]]: younger brother

h4. External links

* "Vocaloid Wikia":[http://vocaloid.wikia.com/wiki/Akita_Neru#History]
* "KnowYourMeme":[http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/akita-neru]

title: bride
body:
A woman getting married in a [[wedding]] ceremony.

Bridalwear differs across cultures. Usually a bride in a western wedding wears a long [[white dress|white]] [[wedding dress]], a [[bridal veil]], and carries a [[bouquet]] of [[flower]]s. A Japanese bride wears a [[shiromuku]] (a white [[kimono]] with red trim), a [[wataboushi]] (a white hood), and may carry accessories tucked into their kimono, such as a [[folding fan]], a [[hakoseko]] (a [[wallet]]), and a [[futokorogatana]] ("chest sword", a small [[dagger]] held in a purse).

h4. Examples

* !post #7962800: Western bride
* !post #2485246: Japanese bride

h4. Related tags

h6. Traditional Japanese bridalwear

* [[shiromuku]] (white wedding kimono)
* [[uchikake]] (formal kimono)
* [[tsunokakushi]] (wedding hat)
* [[wataboushi]] (wedding hood)
* [[folding fan]] (扇子, "sensu")
* [[hakoseko]] (a decorated wallet)
* [[futokorogatana]] ("chest sword", a small dagger held in a purse tucked into the collar of the kimono)
* [[dagger]] (懐剣, "kaiken")

h6. Western bridalwear

* [[wedding dress]]
* [[bridal veil]]
* [[bridal gauntlets]]
* [[elbow gloves]]

body:

You would often see stacks of coins in older eras where coins were more valuable and a person was [[counting money]] manually.

title: kanoe_(blue_archive)
body:
A playable character from [[Blue Archive]]. She is a student of Wild Hunt Academy and a member of Occult Studies Club.

Her full name is [b]Itagaki Kanoe[/b].

Kanoe is a [[mojyo]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] tied into a [[two side up]] with [[hair ornament]]s, [[crossed bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]], [[brown eyes]] and a [[brown halo]]. She wears a [[grey dress|grey]] [[double-breasted]] [[pinafore dress]] overtop a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], a [[diagonal-striped ribbon|diagonal-striped]] [[brown ribbon|brown]] [[neck ribbon]], [[black pantyhose]] and a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]].

Her firearm is a [[Blunderbuss]].

Voiced by: Hyosei
Original artist: [[gulim]] 

h4. Appearance

* !post #9817172: Default

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Kanoe":https://bluearchive.wiki/wiki/Kanoe

title: mexican_standoff
body:
A strategic deadlock or impasse, in which no party can act in a way that ensures victory.

In popular culture, the Mexican standoff is often portrayed as two or more opponents with [[weapon]]s [[aiming|aimed]] at each other, usually at extremely close range, such that each opponent feels equally threatened and does not believe he can strike or shoot first without endangering his own life. 

h4. Examples

title: arknights
body:
A Chinese tower defense mobile game, developed by Hypergryph and published by Hypergryph (Simplified Chinese), Yostar (Japanese, Korean, Global) and Longcheng/Gryphline (Traditional Chinese). It is available in Google Playstore and iOS appstore.

The player is put in the role of the [[Doctor (Arknights)|]], in charge of [i]Rhodes Island[/i], an organization tasked with investigating disasters caused by a mysterious ore known as [[Originium (arknights)|]], and aiding those infected by [[Oripathy lesion (arknights)|Oripathy]], caused by exposure to Originium. As the amnesiac Doctor, the player is put in control over the characters known as Operators.

The game was first announced in 2017. Between 2017 and 2019, it was briefly available for several short beta tests. The game was officially released on May 1st, 2019. International versions in Japanese and English were released Jan. 16th, 2020. The game is available in its native Chinese, Japanese, English and Korean, each with their own app clients. For the first few years of the game's lifetime, character voices were only available in Japanese regardless of region; however, Mandarin character voices were added in September 2021, with dialectal Chinese voices for the Sui siblings added later, and English, Korean character voices along with Italian voices for Siracusian characters were added in 2022, Russian and German voices for characters from Ursus/Leithanien added in late 2023.

In 2022, a spinoff RPG game, [[Arknights: Endfield]], was announced.

title: malamar
body:
[[Pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0687 in the National Pokédex, a Dark/Psychic-type. 

Resembles an [[upside-down]] [[squid]]. Has [[yellow eyes]], [[black sclera]]e, a pink [[beak]], two [[tentacles|tentacle]]-like arms, and several more tentacles atop its head. Known for its powerful [[hypnosis|hypnotic]] abilities.

Evolves from [[Inkay]]. It can also [[Mega pokemon|Mega Evolve]].

title: osoroshii_ko
body:
A [[meme]]-like quote from [[Tsukikage Chigusa]] in [[Glass no Kamen]]. She was surprised by [[Kitajima Maya]]'s exceptional ability as an actress (Maya memorized an entire role after hearing it only once in a live performance.)

In the original story, the quote was used with loud, insane hysterical laughter. In the meme version, "OOO (name)... What a fearsome(scary) girl!", is often used with a [[shaded face]] and [[no pupils]].

title: loincloth
body:
Any of several ancient styles of garment designed to cover the genitals. Usually made from a folded and tied length of cloth, sometimes held in place by a belt. If it has a dangling length of cloth hanging in front and/or or behind, that part is called, for Danbooru's purposes, a [[pelvic curtain]]. 

[[Fundoshi]] are a range of specifically Japanese styles of loincloth. The loincloth's modern replacements are [[panties]], [[briefs]], and [[boxers]].

Both [[loincloth]] and [[fundoshi]] nowadays are used as festival clothing (usually with [[happi]], or alone) , as a [[swimsuit]] (when worn at the [[beach]]) and occasionally, as [[underwear]] (usually worm under [[kimono]], or [[Japanese armor]] etc). Make sure to use the appropriate tag when tagging them.

If the loincloth is attached to a full-body clothing garment, consider tagging [[tabard]] as well [tn](post #7734925)[/tn].

h4. Examples

* !post #3816481: [[dhoti]]
* !post #2599135: [[fundoshi]]
* !post #6471566: [[ecchuu fundoshi]]

* !post #9011322: [[shendyt]]

title: doctor_(arknights)
body:
The player avatar character in [[Arknights]]

Skilled and adaptable leader responsible for managing Rhodes Island, a pharmaceutical organization. While the Doctor's appearance is not explicitly shown in the game, they are depicted as a capable and resourceful individual who coordinates the deployment of operators, plans tactical maneuvers, and oversees operations to combat various threats and challenges across Terra, the game's world. Despite facing daunting obstacles, the Doctor remains calm, determined, and dedicated to the well-being of their team and the success of their missions.

In the anime, they're depicted with [[white hair]] and [[white eyes]], this is mostly considered canon.

If their gender isn't readily apparent within the image, tag them as [[1other]]. If the depicted Doctor is male or female, use [[Male Doctor (Arknights)|]] or [[Female Doctor (Arknights)|]] respectively along with this tag.

Anime VA - Yuki Kaida
Design Artist - 唯@W

h4. Appearance

* !post #3836739: Game
* !post #5745384: Anime
* !post #7581326: [[Male Doctor (Arknights)|]]
* !post #5800520: [[Female Doctor (Arknights)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Female Doctor (Arknights)|]]
* [[Male Doctor (Arknights)|]]
* [[D-Head Doctor]]

title: konosuba!_fantastic_days
body:
[b]KonoSuba: God's Blessing on This Wonderful World! Fantastic Days[/b] is a Japanese smartphone gaming app published by Sumzap for Android and iOS. Based on the [[kono_subarashii_sekai_ni_shukufuku_wo!|KonoSuba]] series, it was released in early 2020. Service for the game on personal computer was later commenced in early 2024.

It is a party-based battle RPG that features an original story, full voice acting, and SD character designs for regular characters such as [[Satou_Kazuma|Kazuma]], [[Aqua (konosuba)|Aqua]], [[Megumin]], [[Darkness (konosuba)|Darkness]], [[Wiz (konosuba)|Wiz]], [[Yunyun (konosuba)|Yunyun]], and more.

Online service for the game ended on January 30, 2025, though an offline version was announced to be in development.

Nakatani Iku is one of the available idols in the mobile game [[idolmaster million live!|THE iDOLM@STER: Million Live!]]

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] in [[one side up|left side up]].

h4. Profile

* Age: 10
* Height: 142cm
* Weight: 37kg
* BWH: 72.0cm-52.0cm-73.0cm
* Birthday: November 16 (Sagittarius)
* Blood type: B
* Handedness: Right
* Hobbies: Watching animation
* Special skill: Waking early
* Likes: [[nakatani iku's mother|Her Mother]]
* Hometown: [[Tokyo (city)|]]
* Voice actress: [[Harashima Akari]] (原嶋あかり)

h4. Appearance

title: girls_band_cry
body:

In addition to the series having similar themes, on 2024-07-05, a joint live concert between [[Togenashi Togeari]] and [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!]]'s [[MyGO!!!!! title: flare
body:
A type of pyrotechnic that produces a bright light or intense heat without an explosion. Flares are used for distress signalling, illumination, or defensive countermeasures in civilian and military applications.

For the photographic effect, use [[lens flare]].

* [[Fireworks]]
* [[Flaring]]

title: playboy_bunny
body:
A woman wearing the uniform of a Playboy bunny (sometimes referred to unofficially as a "bunnysuit"). In Japan, the concept has been divorced from the Playboy brand, and they are simply known as "bunny girls".

The Playboy bunny uniform consists of a typically [[black leotard|black]] [[strapless leotard]] (technically a corset), [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[rabbit ears]], a [[fake tail|fake]] [[rabbit tail]], [[wrist cuffs|detached cuffs]], a [[white collar|white]] [[detached collar]] with a [[black bowtie]], [[black pantyhose|black]] or [[brown pantyhose]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]]. Common variations include substituting the pantyhose with [[fishnet pantyhose|fishnets]] or [[thighhighs]], and the omission of any part of the outfit other than the ears and leotard.

A [b]Playboy Bunny[/b] was originally a cocktail [[waitress]] who worked at a [[Playboy]] Club. The first Playboy Bunny costume was introduced when Hugh Hefner opened his first Playboy Club in Chicago in 1960. 

h4. Examples

* !post #3072582
* !post #7976767
* !post #6813501

h4. Related tags

* [[Daicon Bunny Girl]]
* [[Kittysuit]]—cat themed variant
* [[Male Playboy bunny]]—male variant
* [[Nontraditional Playboy bunny]]—for other animal variants
* [[Oversized breast cup]]—when the cups of the leotard are loose
* [[Playboy bunny swimsuit]]—swimsuit variant
* [[Reverse bunnysuit]]—variant where limbs are covered but torso is not
* [[Tactical Playboy bunny]]—variant that is decked out in tactical gear
* [[Tailcoat Playboy bunny]]—variant with a [[tailcoat]] or tailcoat-like elements
* [[Translucent bunnysuit]]—variant with see-through strip down middle of leotard
* [[Undersized breast cup]] 
* [[Wa bunny]]—Japanese-themed variant

h4. See also

* [[Rabbit pose]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Playboy Bunny": http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Playboy_Bunny

title: list_of_project_diva_modules
body:
This is a list of all tagged module in the [[project diva (series)|Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA-]] series of rhythm games, listed in alphabetical order.

Modules are the [[official alternate costume|costumes]] available for the characters in the games. They can be associated with specific songs, be part of a series, or be a standalone design. As with other Vocaloid [[list_of_Vocaloid_derivatives|derivatives]], artists tend to portray each module as their own individual person (See post #1049414 for example).

title: akita_neru_(school_club_girl)
body:

h4. See also

* [[List of Project Diva Modules]]

title: link
body:
The protagonist of [i][[The Legend of Zelda]][/i]. He is usually depicted as a young boy or a teenager in green clothing who grows to become a hero. He bears the [[Triforce]] of Courage and in many games is the wielder of the [[Master Sword]].

There are several distinct incarnations of Link throughout the entirety of the [i]Legend of Zelda[/i] series, though they share a number of common characteristics.

[expand=Appearances]

title: list_of_vocaloid_derivatives
body:
This is a list of the tagged [[VOCALOID]] derivative characters and related content. Popularized by fans of Crypton Future Media, fanmade variants have grown in number- and most can be traced back to Hatsune Miku.

* They are referred to as 亜種 (Ashu), meaning subspecies, in the Japanese fandom and "Fanloid" in the English fandom.
* The list is set up by official engine generation, character, and chronicle release.
* The Derivatives are listed by company acknowledged types first- then followed by a listings for unofficial types.
* See [[List of VOCALOID characters]] for the official characters.

For other [[list of vocal synthesizers|vocal synth]] derivatives, see [[List of vocal synth derivatives]].

title: lucoa_(maidragon)
body:
[[Kobayashi-San chi no Maidragon]] character. A genderswapped personification of Mesoamerican God [[Quetzalcoatl (mythology)|]].

She wears a black [[tank top]], short jeans and red [[baseball cap]]. Her hair color is yellowish-green (with bright green color on the tips of her [[long hair]]). Her eyes are [[heterochromia|bicolored]] (her left eye color is black with yellow pupils and her right eye color is green). Her [[horns]] are tube-shaped and she has [[huge breasts]].

She is often depicted in fan art as a shotacon occasionally preying on [[Magatsuchi Shouta]], who summoned her into the human world.

She's the origin of the [[meme]] [[Japanizing Beam]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4600151
other_names: ケツァルコアトル(小林さんちのメイドラゴン)

title: ilulu_(maidragon)
body:
A Chaos faction dragon from [[Kobayashi-san Chi no Maidragon]] that wanted to destroy Tokyo and was defeated by [[Tohru (maidragon)|]] with the assistance of [[Elma (maidragon)|]]. Was befriended by [[Kobayashi (maidragon)|]], lives with her like [[Tohru (maidragon)|]] and [[Kanna Kamui]] and seems to be attracted to her just like Tohru.

In her [[dragon girl]] form, she has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[red eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], [[pointy ears]] and [[curled horns|curled]] [[dragon horns]] as well as a [[red tail|red]] [[dragon tail]]. She is often seen wearing a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[black shirt]] and [[black thighhighs]].
Noted for her [[huge breasts]] (130/55/70 - her official [[three sizes]]) particularly [[oppai loli|on her petite frame]] (130 cm tall), stemming from her incomplete mastery of assuming a human form.

Previously an manga-exclusive character, she later made her anime debut in the 2nd season of Maidragon in 2021.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4643059
other_names: イルル(小林さんちのメイドラゴン)

title: bent_v
body:
The [[V]] sign but with one or both fingers bent or drooping.

Sometimes it shows the character is [[embarrassed]] or unconfident, but other times they're tired, e.g. [[after sex]].

In some places, this is a [[two-finger salute]] used by Cub Scouts, meant to look like wolf ears.

h4. Examples

* !post #5887552
* !post #7963809

title: owari_akane
body:
Character from [[Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair]]. She's the Ultimate Gymnast (超高校級の「体操部」)

Owari has [[tan|tan skin]], [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] button up [[shirt]] with the top buttons undone, [[cleavage|revealing her large chest size]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], and [[no socks|sockless]] [[loafers]].

title: keffiyeh
body:
Keffiyeh (Arabic: كوفية‎ kūfiyyah) is a traditional [[arabian clothes|Middle Eastern]] square-shaped headdress which is generally worn on the head or around the neck. Can be plain or often features distinct pattern that resemble houndstooth, [[fringe trim|fringed]] or not.

If the keffiyeh-like pattern is visible on a [[turban]], this tag can apply.

There are many different terms to refer to it:
* Arabic: ghutrah (غُترَة), shemagh (شماغ), ḥaṭṭah (حَطّة), mashadah (مَشَدة)
* Kurdish: cemedanî (جه مه داني‎)
* Persian: chafiye (چَفیِه‎), dastmal yazdi (دستمال یزدی‎)

h4. Examples
* !post #8546988: Worn like a [[shawl]]. Traditionally white-black and white-red.
* !post #4817789: With an [[agal]].
* !post #5944716: Covering the whole head and face.
* !post #7696138: [[palestine|Palestinian]]-style keffiyeh with loose fishnet-like pattern, worn like a [[scarf]].
* !post #5701856: Modern, "tactical" keffiyeh with unconventional coloring.

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]
* [[Tag Group:Neck and Neckwear]]
h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Keffiyeh":https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/Keffiyeh

title: nagato_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Nagato[/i]. Character design by [[Alisa (kuro no sakura)|]], voiced by [[Kuno Misaki]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a [[hime cut]] with bird-like [[hair ornament]]s, [[yellow eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[fox ears]]. Her default outfit consists of an [[off shoulder]] [[red dress|red]] [[pleated dress|pleated]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[detached sleeves]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge holding two large half-circle hull pieces containing her 41 cm twin gun mounts with [[shimenawa]] and [[shide]], plus six 14 cm single guns.

In contrast to her ship class, she is portrayed as a child(-like?) character. Her young appearance may be a reference to how Japanese schoolchildren donated funds for the two battleships, especially [[Mutsu (Azur Lane)|]].

As she looks like - and perhaps [i]is[/i] - a little girl, she is often contrasted with [[Nagato (kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]], to the point where the latter goes "Nagamon":/pools/8242 after "herself".



h4. Skins

* !post #3144162: Default
* !post #3142372: [[Nagato (old design) (azur lane)|Old design]]
* !post #3144165: [[Nagato (great fox's white gown) (azur lane)|Great Fox's White Gown]] (Wedding skin)

title: sugar_lights_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by [[Ishikawa Yui]]. 

A scientist [[horse girl]] who is confined to a wheelchair due to injuries in the past, she wants to realize her dreams, presumably of becoming a successful runner, through her invention.

She is the host of the [i]Run, Mecha Umamusume![/i] scenario, being the creator of [[Mecha Umamusume ST-2 (umamusume)|]] (or "Saty" for short), built in her image.

title: mei_(honkai_impact)
body:
[[Honkai (series)]] character, voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]]. She resembles the [[Raiden Mei (APHO)|adult version]] of [[Raiden Mei]].

"Mei" refers to two separate characters depending on the game. In the [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] world, Dr. MEI was a scientist of Fire MOTH from the Previous Era. She was also the foremother of the Kaslana lineage. In the [[Benghuai Xueyuan]] world, her full name is [[Raiden Mei]] and was a scientist and the leader of Massive Electric Corp in the Era Zero, inherited from her father [[Raiden Ryoma]].


h4. See also

* [[Acheron (honkai: star rail)|]] - her [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart
* [[Raiden Shogun]] - her [[Genshin Impact]] counterpart
* [[Vike (Zenless Zone Zero)|]] - her [[Zenless Zone Zero]] counterpart

title: stelle_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
The playable female protagonist of [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Usually distinguishable from [[caelus (honkai: star rail)|Caelus]] in [[POV]] by her normal [[black gloves]]. Voiced by [[Ishikawa Yui]] (JP) and [[Rachael Chau]] (EN, 2023-2025)/Chloe Eves (EN, 2025- ). 

In the Japanese translation her name is Sei.

Her outfit consists of a [[white shirt]], [[black jacket]] with the Nameless' badge (a stylized Astral Express at warp) on the left breast side, [[black skirt]] that mostly obscures her green [[thigh strap]] on her left leg, and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[ankle boots]]. 

If she and [[caelus (honkai: star rail)|Caelus]] appear together, add the [[dual persona]] tag.

title: lila_milla_rira
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] series. She first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985. 

A regular [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] veteran who isn't too fond of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] but fights alongside them anyway because she is ordered to do so. 

[b]Lila Milla Rira[/b] is a skillful veteran [[mecha]] [[pilot]], able to control the notoriously finicky [[Galbaldy Beta]] [[mobile suit]]. [spoiler]However, even her experience and skills are not enough to defeat [[Kamille Bidan]] in his [[Gundam Mk II]] mobile suit who shots her down in a [[space]] [[duel]] early in the series, Lila realizing in her last moments how helpless "oldtypes" are against the powers of "newtypes" like Kamille.[/spoiler] 

[spoiler]This encounter would worsen the animosity between Kamille and [[Jerid Messa]] even further, as Jerid was secretely in love with the older woman.[/spoiler]
other_names: ライラ・ミラ・ライラ

title: galbaldy_beta
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RMS-117 Galbaldy β[/b]

An updated version of a leftover [[Zeon]] [[mobile suit]] project, the MS-17 [[Galbaldy Alpha]], which was in turn a redesign of the [[Gyan]] to account for the [[Gelgoog]]'s mid range characteristics and equipped with a [[beam rifle]]. 

The Galbaldys left behind were captured by the [[Earth Federation]], and gradually upgraded with the newer technologies such as the linear seat and new thrusters. It was somewhat superior to the [[Hizack]] and the old Gelgoog - but in the growing tensions leading up to the [[zeta_gundam|Gryps Conflict]], the Gelgoog wasn't even close to the standard anymore. 

The Galbaldy Beta was used by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] and the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. One unit was piloted by [[Lila Milla Rira]].

title: jamitov_hymen
body:
A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] universe. He first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985. Also appears in [[Gundam 0083]] (1991).

[b]Jamitov Hymen[/b] is a former top [[Earth Federation]] General who is the mastermind behind the foundation and rise of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]], the elite organization of the EF Forces. 

From his perch at the pinnacle of the Earth Federation's [[military]] command structure, Jamitov uses the Titans as a private army to further his own scheme for world domination. Cruel, devious, and utterly amoral, Jamitov will stop at nothing to impose his own brand of Earth-supremacist ideology on the suffering peoples of the [[space]] colonies. 

[spoilers]Dies at the end of The Gryps War shot to death by [[Paptimus Scirocco]], who betrayed Jamitov in order to gain total control of the Titans army.[/spoilers]
other_names: ジャミトフ・ハイマン

title: eat_sleep_x_repeat_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] involving the statement, "Eat Sleep X Repeat.", where the "X" can be replaced by any activity, but usually a specific [[video game]]. Often appears on a [[t-shirt]] or [[clothes writing|other clothing]].

Originated as "[[Eat Sleep Rave Repeat]]", which was then picked up by the [[Fortnite]] community and became "Eat Sleep Fortnite Repeat."

title: komachi_el_mistica_(shuniku)
body:
PPE] Komachi El Mystica [Kinuoka First/Student]
I'll be participating in this project! Nice to meet you! ^^ [Settings] Name: Komachi El Mystica, Arcana: Tank, Initial Persona: Nekomata, Height: Short, Weight: Light, Speech Endings: Mon! (Mon!) First Person: Oira, Second Person: Free, Speech Style: Kanji replaced with Katakana, Affiliation: Kinuoka First High School, Second Year Student [Additional Information] It's hard to tell, but I'm Mexico → Mexico → Mexican Girl. I'm a Japanese-Mexican exchange student. Oh, and I think I awakened to my Persona abilities on my third day abroad, when I hit my teacher's head with a tope suicida from the second floor. [Explanation] Nekomata: An aged cat yokai. Apparently, there are house nekomata and wild nekomata. [Original Source] Reference video about Lucha Libre: http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm6342763. Please let me know if you have any problems.Tank

Komachi El Mystica

Affiliation

Kinuka First

This Old Man

Aerial☆Slaying Technique

Profile

A masked girl with a deep love for lucha libre.

On her first day abroad, she caused numerous cultural conflicts, such as performing a tope con hilo on a teacher who reprimanded her for wearing a mask.

She currently founded an unofficial lucha libre club and is training to become

title: kyogoku_natsume_(elina_kuroe_no_daarin)
body:
PPE] Kyogoku Natsume [Kinuka First/Faculty]
Originator (illust/12482652)
■I've been waiting for this! I'll be participating!

Name: Kyogoku Natsume
Affiliation: Kinuka First (Faculty) - Head of Year. Teaches general science, including physics, biology, chemistry, earth science, and astronomy.
Weapon: Halberd
Arcana: Empress
Persona: Aphrodite
Community: Shichino Toshikazu (illust/12634337)

When it comes to teaching, she's always kind, regardless of grade level, but she's also a sadist. Even if someone calls her an old hag, she'll still give them a loving embrace.
She holds her weapon in one hand, supporting it on her shoulder. She swings it around with great force. When her students are in trouble, she'll deliver a loving drop kick.
She's surprisingly feminine, despite her face. She uses a chopper bike for transportation.
When I get emotional, I speak in Kyoto dialect. "Don't be stupid!"

■Captions will be edited as needed. ■Oh, thank you so much for the CV tag, Captain Nagumo and Lady Haman, ha ha!
■Dragon Quest 141, thank you for placing 14th in the regional rankings!.CHARACTER

Empress

Kyogoku Natsume

Affiliation

Kinuka First

Halberd

Profile

A teacher at Kinuka First High School, herself a Kinuka First graduate and a hardcore delinquent. She awakened to her Persona abilities relatively early and now provides support to students who have just awakened.

She is earnest and reliable at heart, with a strong sense of justice and a big sister-like personality, but sometimes gets angry and acts recklessly.

She loves gambling and is a gambling addict, but she is courageous beyond compare and becomes even more enthusiastic when cornered, giving her great luck in crucial situations.

She was locked in a dark place as punishment as a child, which is why she has a deep fear of dark places and ghost stories. Traumatized.

Her starting Persona is "Aphrodite" and her weapon is a halberd.

"Lucky you! I'll keep on coming!"

"If you tell me a scary story, I'll knock you out. Seriously."

"But you have to buy me some spicy ramen later."

"If something bad happens, I'll help you out, Sensei.Profile Jata

Sensitivity/Facial Expressions

"He's quite expressive." "He's straightforward, but passionate when it comes to teaching his students."

"He loves kids with a strong sense of justice."

Suddenly

Persona Ratio

He's missing his legs from the knees down. If you were to include the whole body, it would be considered large.

Speech Style

First Person: "I" Second Person: "You" "You." A typical feminine style of speech.

When he gets emotional, his accent becomes more like a Kyoto dialect.

Kyogoku Natsume

Scorpio, 29 years old, Blood Type 0

Height: 169cm, Weight: 52kg

Likes: Spicy food, alcohol

Likes: Dark places, ghost stories, insults, bullying the weak

Special Skills: Kickboxing, Arm Wrestling

title: pulonia_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC in [[Genshin Impact]].

A giant, humanoid robot that is often accompanying (and sometimes carrying) [[Sandrone (Genshin Impact)|Sandrone]].

It is primarily silver and gold in color. A large symbol covers most of its face. It wears a [[hat]], a [[coat]], and an [[ascot]]. It wears two gear ornaments - one on its hat, and another holding its ascot in place.

title: road
body:
A road is a route that has been [[pavement|paved]] or otherwise improved for travel by foot or vehicle. Possible road surfaces include dirt, gravel, concrete, and asphalt.

Paved roads in [[city|urban]] settings are generally referred to as [[street|streets]]. They may have adjoining [[sidewalk|sidewalks]] for pedestrian use. Narrow lanes too small for vehicular use are called [[alley|alleys]].

Public roads, especially multi-lane arterial roads and major roads between cities, may be called [[highway|highways]].

title: priest
body:
A person having the authority or power to administer religious rites; in particular, rites of sacrifice to, and propitiation of, a deity or deities. Their office or position is the priesthood, a term which may also apply to such persons collectively. Commonly found within the hierarchy of [[Christianity]], [[Hinduism]] and [[Shinto|Shintoism]].

For the female counterpart, see [[priestess]].

title: help:tasks
body:
h4. Tasks to Do

[tn][b]Work in progress:[/b] feel free to add entries, refine existing searches, add variants to searches for Gold- users where possible, and so on. Help is appreciated![/tn]

This page lists generic, recurring tasks that may be of note for current and aspiring tag gardeners. Much of this list is adapted from the old [Shinjidude's Tasks to do thread](/forum_topics/5076), but put into wiki format to make it easier to organize and expand.

Searches that require a [[help:users|Gold+ account]] are marked with an asterisk [code]*[/code] and put towards the bottom of a section.

[expand=Table of contents]
1. [Missing identification](#dtext-missing-idenification)
2. [Undertaggings](#dtext-undertagging)
3. [Mistaggings](#dtext-mistagging)
[/expand]

h4#missing-idenification. Missing identification

Pertaining to missing basic identification, meaning artist / copyright / character tags, as well as source.

h5. {{artist_request}} | {{copyright_request}} | {{character_request}}
The basic "fixme" tags.

h5. {{pixiv:any -bad_id arttags:0}}
Posts from Pixiv that don't have any artist tag, but also are not marked as a dead source, so are likely recoverable.

h5. {{status:active gentags:<5 -tagme}}
Candidates for filing a [[tagme]] request. Use some common sense of course, a {{no_humans object_focus}} post will likely struggle to reach 10, let alone 20 gentags.

h5. {{blue_archive chartags:0}}
Missing character tags. Replace the [[Blue Archive]] example with whatever copyright you're familiar enough with.

h5. {{translation_request -check_translation -partially_translated translated}} *
Application of [[translation request]] and [[translated]] simultaneously. Probably needs the request tag removed.
* Goldless variant, but less precise: {{translation_request translated}} 

h5. {{chartags:>0 copytags:0 -original}} *
Has a character tag, but no copyright tag and is not an [[original]] post.

h4#undertagging. Undertaggings

Pertaining to missing tags where they can be applied.

h5. {{beach -outdoors}}
Likely missing an [[outdoors]] tag.

h5. {{male_focus -1boy -multiple_boys}} *
Male focus? Likely missing character counters.

h5. {{-1girl -multiple_girls -1boy -multiple_boys -1other -multiple_others -no_humans -mecha}} *
Needs character counters applied.
* Platinum- search, but less precise: {{-1girl -multiple_girls -1boy -multiple_boys -1other -multiple_others}} *

h5. {{(1girl or 1boy or 1other) -multiple_girls -multiple_boys -multiple_others -(1girl 1boy) -solo -multiple_views }} *
Likely missing [[solo]] or [[multiple views]].

h5. {{nude -nipples -from_behind -pasties -covering_privates -portrait}} *
Likely needs a [[nipples]] tag.
* Goldless variant, but less precise: {{nude -nipples}}

h5. {{(multiple_penises or multiple_fellatio or multiple_paizuri or double_handjob) -group_sex}} *
Possibly warranting a [[group sex]] tag.

h5. {{(doggystyle or group_sex or rape) -sex}} *
Possibly missing a [[sex]] tag.
* Goldless users can focus their search on a single tag e.g. {{group_sex -sex}}.

h5. {{(vaginal or anal) -fingering -insertion -tentacles -fisting -sex -after_vaginal -after_anal}} *
Likely missing an insertion, [[sex]], etc. tag.

h5. {{group_sex -gangbang -threesome -orgy}} *
Tagged [[group sex]], but possibly needs a tag for the specific kind of act.

h5. {{(oral or 69) -fellatio -cunnilingus -tentacles -anilingus -testicle_sucking -licking_testicle}} *
Possibly missing a tag for the specific kind of act, namely [[fellatio]] and/or [[cunnilingus]], or mistagged [[oral]].

h5. {{lying -on_side -on_back -on_stomach}} *
Tagged [[lying]], but not on which side.
* Goldless variant, but less precise: {{lying -on_*}}

h5. {{swimsuit -bikini -one-piece_swimsuit -school_swimsuit -competition_swimsuit -sling_bikini}} *
Tagged with [[swimsuit]], but not the specific kind of swimsuit.

h4#mistagging. Mistaggings

h5. {{midriff swimsuit}} | {{midriff nude}}
Possibly [[stomach]]s mistagged as [[midriff]].

h5. {{solo solo_focus}} | {{solo multiple_views}}
Mutual exclusivity.

h5. {{cow}}
Frequently has posts that should be [[cowboy shot]] mixed in due to autocomplete mishaps, sometimes [[cow girl]]s.
* Take a close look at the image to make sure there isn't a hidden animal.

h5. {{completely_nude upper_body}} 
Violating the [[completely nude]] guidelines:
[quote]
If you can't see their crotch or lower, use [[nude]] instead.
[/quote]

h5. {{partially_submerged ai:wading}}
[[Partially submerged]] is frequently confused with [[wading]].

h5. {{looking_at_viewer closed_eyes}}
Mistagged [[looking at viewer]], probably replace with [[facing viewer]].
* Gold+ users: add [[solo]] for more accurate results.

h5. {{scenery (cowboy_shot or is:nsfw)}}
Possibly not [[scenery]].

h5. {{back -from_behind}}
Likely missing [[from behind]].

h5. {{solo 1girl 1boy}} *
Mistagged [[solo]] or improper character counters.

h5. {{heterochromia one_eye_closed solo}} *
Bad application of [[heterochromia]].
* Goldless variant, but less accurate: {{heterochromia one_eye_closed}} 

h5. {{(penis or pussy or cum or sex or footjob or fingering or masturbation or oral or paizuri or rape) -rating:e}} *
Should probably be re-rated to {{rating:explicit}}.
* Goldless users can focus on a single tag e.g. {{sex -rating:e}}

title: romance_of_the_three_kingdoms_(video_game)
body: [b]Romance of the Three Kingdoms[/b] (三國志, Sangokushi; lit. "Records of the Three Kingdoms") is a series of turn-based tactical role-playing simulation grand strategy wargames produced by [[Koei]]. Originating from Japan in 1985, fourteen installments of the game have been published in Japan, Taiwan, China, South Korea and North America to date. While the game's title as it was released in English refers to the 14th century historical novel [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms]] (三國演義) by [[Luo Guanzhong]], the title as it was released in Japan and Chinese regions refers to the 3rd century historical text [[Records of the Three Kingdoms]] (三國志) by [[Chen Shou]].

title: romance_of_the_three_kingdoms
body:
[b]Romance of the Three Kingdoms[/b] is a Chinese historical novel attributed to "Luo Guanzhong":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luo_Guanzhong] detailing the history and folklore behind the period from 184 (The Yellow Turban Rebellion) to 280 (The unification of China by Jin) while passing through, among other things; the Battle of Chibi (208), the formation of the Three Kingdoms (years 220, 221 and 229), and the fall of Shu as well as the takeover of Wei by Jin (263-265).

The novel and the various individual stories within have a mind-boggingly high number of adaptations in every media and they have inspired many other stories involving the characters.

This tag is for either historical references to the Three Kingdoms period of [[China]], or romanticized depictions of the events and characters from the novel. 

h4. See also

* [[Ikkitousen]]
* [[Koihime Musou]]
* [[Player Na Wa]]
* [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms (video game)]] 
* [[Sangokushi Taisen]]
* [[Shin Sangoku Musou]]
* [[Total War: Three Kingdoms]] 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Romance of the Three Kingdoms":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romance_of_the_Three_Kingdoms]

title: koseki_bijou
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and the Sparkling Gem of hololive English [[holoadvent|-Advent-]], the third generation [[hololive English]]. Designed by [[Kitada Mo]]. Also goes by her nickname, "Biboo".

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] to [[purple hair|purple]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[colored inner hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She also has [[purple gemstone]]s embedded or protruding on various parts of her body, most notably a large [[chest jewel]], small gems [[jewel under eye|under her right eye]] and on [[hand jewel|the back of her hands]] and [[detached wings]]. Despite appearances, her feet are not made out of gemstone and instead she has regular human feet encased in gemstone that she can remove at will. Her default hairstyle consists of [[hair flaps]], [[double-parted bangs|double parted]] [[center-flap bangs]] and [[sidelocks]].

title: makoto_nanaya
body:
A character in the [[Blazblue]] series. Makoto is a [[squirrel girl|squirrel]] beastkin, and was bullied at the academy she attended because of it. [[Tsubaki Yayoi]] and [[Noel Vermillion]] stood up for her and they became fast friends.

She later worked in the Intelligence Department as a spy and data gatherer, though she was actually a double agent in the service of [[Kokonoe (blazblue)|]], and is proficient with [[dual wielding|dual]] [[tonfa]]s and martial arts. Her most notable characteristic is an orange [[crop top]] that expose her [[underboob]] and a [[fluffy]] [[squirrel tail]].

h4. Apperance

* !post #3011282: [[Blazblue: Cross Tag Battle]]

title: hard_rock_stadium
body:
A multi-use [[stadium]] in [[Miami]], primarily used as the home field for the [[Miami Dolphins]] [[National Football league|NFL]] team.

A temporary [[racetrack]] is built around the stadium grounds for the [[Formula One]] Miami Grand Prix, integrating parts of the parking lot along with dedicated racing pavement. The circuit is known as the Miami International Autodrome, and is constructed and then disassembled each year, being used solely for the F1 race and it's supporting events.

title: kufi_(hat)
body:
Taqiyah (Arabic: طاقية) or also known as kufi is a type of brimless, rounded [[skullcap]] worn by [[islam|Muslim]] men. It is widely recognized as religious and cultural symbol of Muslims associated with humility. The practical purpose of wearing one is to keep one's hair away from the forehead so it will not obstruct the forehead while doing prostration during salah (prayer), though not mandatory.

Many taqiyahs are traditionally white or plain-colored and made from tight-fitting knit material. While some regional variants may come in slightly rigid material, multicolored, and patterned.

Not to be confused with [[songkok]] which has rectangular profile or the Turkish [[fez hat]]. 

h1. See also
* [[Arabian clothes]]
* [[kippah]]
* [[zucchetto]]
* [[Tag Group:Headwear]]

title: atelier_escha_&_logy
body:
The 15th game in the [[atelier (series)|Atelier]] series and the second in the Dusk trilogy. The Japanese title [i]Escha to Logy no Atelier[/i] parodies the word "eschatology":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eschatology which is the study of the end of humankind. Unlike many of the previous games, players can choose between a female protagonist named [[Escha Malier]] or a male protagonist named [[Logix Ficsario]] (a.k.a. Logy). The story remains the same overall, but some events and items are exclusive to each character.

Logy reappears in [[Atelier Sophie]], albeit as a completely different character in the Mysterious arc of games. Likewise, Escha appears with him in [[Atelier Firis]], also as a different character.

title: haggis
body:
Haggis is a savoury pudding containing sheep's pluck (heart, liver and lungs); minced with [[onion]], [[oatmeal]], [[suet]], spices, and salt, mixed with stock, traditionally encased in the animal's stomach though now often in an artificial casing instead. According to the 2001 English edition of the Larousse Gastronomique: "Although its description is not immediately appealing, haggis has an excellent nutty texture and delicious savoury flavour".

Source: Wikipedia article https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haggis

title: head_tilt
body:
When a character tilts their head to one side, which is commonly done as either an inquisitive gesture, or a cute gesture, though it can be done for any reason.

[b]Use common sense when applying this tag: the head tilt has to be noticeable, otherwise every single picture on site could be tagged with it.[/b]

Use [[head back]] if tilted upwards. Use [[turning head]] if the head is turned instead of tilted.

title: covered_penetration
body:
Penetration that is hidden by clothes (usually a [[pelvic curtain]], [[dress]] or [[skirt]]) or an object held by the character. Often the penetration is partially visible through a [[see-through silhouette]].

The equivalent of [[fellatio under mask]] but for [[sex]].

Do not use this tag for [[convenient censoring]] or other foreground objects that have no relation to the scene.

h4. See also

* [[clothed sex]]
* [[implied sex]]
* [[fellatio under mask]]
other_names: これ絶対入ってるよね

title: electronic_arts
body:
An American video Game company. Known for producing many multiplayer focused games, and employing questionable monetization systems in many of their titles. Throughout the years, they have acquired numerous studios and come to own many franchises, including holding the exclusive rights to produce the Madden [[national football league|NFL]] [[american football]] games and [[FIFA]] [[soccer|football]] games (until 2023 when they lost the FIFA license). They also had an exclusive license to produce video games based on the [[Star Wars]] series.

title: mori_calliope
body:
A [[virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] part of [[hololive English]]'s 1st generation, [[holoMyth]]. The [[Grim Reaper]]'s apprentice. Designed by [[yukisame]].

She has [[pink eyes|pink]] or [[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[pale skin]]. Her default hairstyle consists of [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[pink hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[sidelocks]].

title: mori_calliope_(the_story_thus_far)
body:
The 12th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Mori Calliope]], introduced in "her 5th anniversary VR stream":[https://youtu.be/MryxToVvJO0] of the same name.

It consists of a [[black jacket]] with [[two-tone jacket|a pink interior]] worn [[off shoulder]] over a [[black shirt|matching]] [[halter shirt]], [[torn jeans|torn]] [[black pants|black]] [[skinny jeans]] and [[black shoes|black]] or [[white shoes|white]] [[platform shoes]]. She also has a [[black hat|black]] [[beanie]], [[glasses]] and a pair of [[headphones around neck|headphones around her neck]] as optional accessories.

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] for this costume is a [[wolf cut]] with [[blunt bangs]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9958828: Reference sheet

title: mushoku_tomei_sai
body:
Literally "Colorless Nameless Festival"

A [[Vocaloid]]/[[list of vocal synthesizers|vocal synth]] event where producers create new songs to be uploaded anonymously and without any music videos or illustrations. After the event ends, producers can freely reupload their songs under their own names and with MVs or illustrations, often doing so under the hashtag "#無色透名美術館":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/無色透名美術館] (Mushoku Tomei Gallery).

The event has run yearly since 2023.

h4. External links

* "Official site":[https://site.nicovideo.jp/mushokutomeisai/]

body:
Character from [[Gachiakuta]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[long sidelocks]] tied into a [[ponytail]] worn over her left shoulder, [[brown eyes]], and wears the standard supporter uniform. The uniform consisting of a [[backpack]], grey [[grey hat|hat]], [[grey jacket|jacket]] [[grey pants|pants]], and [[grey gloves|gloves]], and a pair of [[black boots]]. She also wears a [[brown choker]].

title: victini
body:
A Psychic/Fire-type Mythical [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0494 in the National Pokédex.

A [[rabbit]]-like creature with v-shaped ears, [[blue eyes]], [[fangs]], and two wing-like tails. It can [[flying|fly]], and is often seen making a "[[V]]" with its fingers.

Japanese name: [b]Victini[/b]

title: closure_(arknights)
body:
[[Arknights]] NPC. A Rhodes Island operator and one of its founding members, head of the Engineering Department. Appears in various parts of the story, also appears as the owner of the in-game shop. She is a Vampire Sarkaz.

Real Name: Ada Church

The design on Closure's T-shirt is a parody of [[Octocat]], the logo and mascot of the software development platform [[GitHub]].

title: cthoni_andor
body: Kutohni is an antagonist of [[Gachiakuta]], and member of the Vandals organization, a group all of whom are Givers. Standing at only 4'11" (152cm) she is lean but is surprisingly muscular. She has [[short hair|short]] light [[blue hair]] with a [[huge ahoge]], [[yellow eyes]], and has several [[tattoo]]s on her [[wrist tattoo|wrists]] and [[ankle tattoo|ankles]]. She wears a [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]] exposing [[midriff]] and [[navel]], [[two-tone shorts]], [[fingerless gloves]], and a [[brown choker]].

title: catarina_devon
body:
An antagonistic character from the manga and anime [[One Piece]].
She's the only female high-profile member of the Blackbeard Pirates.
At some point during the story or backstory, she ate the [i]Dog-Dog Fruit, Model: Nine-Tailed Fox[/i], giving her the ability to transform into a nine-tailed fox.

title: rollo_(tales)
body:
Supporting character from [[Tales of Xillia 2]]. [[Ludger Will Kresnik|Ludger]] and [[Julius Will Kresnik|Julius]]'s fat pet cat who decides to follow Ludger at the beginning of his journey, seemingly of his own accord. Quickly becomes friendly with [[Elle Mel Marta|Elle]].

Japanese name: [b]Lulu[/b]

title: victor_(tales)
body:
[[Tales of Xillia 2]] character.

[[elle mel marta|Elle]]'s father who had sent her to find the Land of Canaan.

title: tales_of_xillia_2
body:
The fourteenth mothership title in Namco's [[tales of (series)|Tales of...]] series for the Playstation 3, released on November 1, 2012 in Japan. Character designs are done by Okumura Daigo, and is the first game released by Bandai Namco Games after Namco Tales Studio was dissolved. All of the playable cast in [[Tales of Xillia]] return, as well as [[gaius (tales)|Gaius]] and [[muzet (tales)|Muzet]] as new playable characters.

[b][i]Please note that there may be "late-arrival spoilers":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LateArrivalSpoiler for the prequel.[/i][/b]

h4.Characters

* [[Elle Mel Marta]]
* [[Julius Will Kresnik]]
* [[Ludger Will Kresnik]]
* [[rollo (tales)|Lulu]]

h4.External links

* Wikipedia: "Tales of Xillia 2":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tales_of_Xillia_2

テイルズオブエクシリア2

title: milla_maxwell_(tox2)
body:
A version of [[Milla Maxwell]] hailing from a Fractured Dimension (parallel universe), where she is more submissive towards that dimension's [[muzet (tales)|Muzet]]. She is pulled out of her world into the Prime Dimension, and befriends [[ludger will kresnik|Ludger]] and [[elle mel marta|Elle]]. Fractured Milla's outfit is primarily a black and white short dress, black sleeves, and mismatched black thigh boots. She also doesn't have the green-tipped ahoge that Prime Milla is known for.

[spoilers]Unfortunately, this Milla's existence prevents the Prime Dimension's Milla from materializing, since the Prime and Fractured variants of a person are not allowed to exist simultaneously. In order to make Prime Milla return to the party, Fractured Millia has to die and disappear.[/spoilers]

title: ludger_will_kresnik
body:
The main, silent protagonist of [[Tales of Xillia 2]], Ludger is a talented cook and homemaker who has to work off a huge debt after getting involved a train accident. He meets [[elle mel marta|Elle]] and gets involved in her journey, which will decide the fate of the world.

In the English version, he's simply referred to as [b]Ludger Kresnik[/b]

title: claire_bennett
body: The main heroine of [[Tales of Rebirth]] and the first to be an NPC (preceded by [[Elle Mel Marta]]). She is a kind and caring girl from Soolz who is kidnapped early in the game, and her foster brother [[Veigue Lungberg]] goes to rescue her.

title: jujutsu_kaisen
body:
Manga written and drawn by [[Akutami Gege]], serialized in [[Weekly Shounen Jump]] in 2018. Received an anime adaptation by MAPPA which aired on MBS from October 2020 to March 2021.

A prequel, Jujutsu Kaisen 0, received an film adapation by MAPPA which premiered on December 2021 in Japan. 

A sequel spin-off manga, [[Jujutsu Kaisen Mojuro]], written by Akutami and illustrated by [[Iwasaki Yuuji]], began serialization in September 2025.

title: limiter_(tsukumo_sana)
body:
An accessory for [[Hololive English|hololive EN]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Tsukumo Sana]], who almost always wears it on her head like an [[ahoge]]. It's a thin, light-purple piece of material that sticks out from the top of the head and then spirals outward, similar to a [[mosquito coil]]. If a post clearly shows Sana not wearing her limiter, it's probably a case of the [[no headgear]] tag.

Lore-wise, it's meant to shrink her down to a size where she can safely interact with humans, since her true form is almost 1.7 billion metres tall and would make it impossible for her to be anywhere near Earth (which is only about 12.7 million metres wide) without immediately destroying it through sheer gravitational force.

title: advance_wars_2:_black_hole_rising
body:
A turn-based strategy video game developed by Intelligent Systems and published by [[Nintendo]] for the [[Game Boy Advance]]. It was released in North America and PAL regions in 2003. It is the second game in the [[Advance Wars]] sub-series of Nintendo Wars.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Advance Wars 2: Black Hole Rising":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advance_Wars_2:_Black_Hole_Rising

title: neotank
body: A unit in [[Advance Wars]], [[Advance Wars 2: Black Hole Rising]] and [[Advance Wars: Dual Strike]]. It is a [[turretless tank]] with a spherical body and four kneeless legs which are tipped with small wheels.

title: advance_wars
body:
A series of military-themed turn-based strategy video games, predominantly developed by Intelligent Systems and published by [[Nintendo]]. Originally developed exclusively for the Japanese market, the series later expanded to the North American and European market with Advance Wars. 

Players take control of 2-4 nations engaged in a war, where they must defeat the opposing side(s)' forces using a selection of different unit types.

A third-person real-time series of strategy games called [i]Battalion Wars[/i] was developed by Kuju Entertainment.

h4. Main Entries

* Famicom Wars
* Game Boy Wars
* Game Boy Wars Turbo
* Super Famicom Wars
* Game Boy Wars 2
* Game Boy Wars 3
* [[Advance Wars]]
* [[Advance Wars 2: Black Hole Rising]]
* [[Advance Wars: Dual Strike]]
* [[Advance Wars: Days of Ruin]]
* [[Advance Wars 1+2: Re-Boot Camp]]

h4. Battalion Wars

* [[Battalion Wars]]
* Battalion Wars 2

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Wars (series)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wars_(series)
